0.title: K'taka to give ₹10 lakh aid to family of girl raped, killed by teacher
0.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has announced financial aid of ₹10 lakh for the family of a 10-year-old girl who was raped and killed by her 51-year-old tuition teacher in the Mandya district. The girl's body was found in the sump of an under-construction building on Thursday. The teacher lured her with chocolates and took her to a deserted area.

1.title: 18-year-old Punjab boy dies of suspected drug overdose, probe on
1.article_body: A day after an 18-year-old boy died of a suspected drug overdose in Punjab's Khadur Sahib village, police have initiated inquest proceedings under CrPC's Section 174. The victim's body was found allegedly in a shrubby area of the village on Saturday. According to his family members, a drug injection was also found intact in the body.

2.title: Forever grateful: Vicky Kaushal on 1 year of 'Sardar Udham'
2.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to Instagram on Sunday to share a post marking one year since the release of his film 'Sardar Udham'. Sharing a few pictures from the sets, he wrote, "It's been a year. Forever grateful." The film was based on the life of Udham Singh, who assassinated Michael O'Dwyer in revenge for the 1919 Jallianwala Bagh massacre.

3.title: Want to bring change in our way of work: Cong Prez candidate Tharoor
3.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Shashi Tharoor on Sunday said that his opponent Mallikarjun Kharge is an experienced leader, adding that if Kharge wins the elections, "we'll work in cooperation naturally". "There's no problem with our ideology, but I want to bring a change in our way of work," Tharoor said. The Congress Presidential poll will be held tomorrow, October 17.

4.title: Not every film is made for Oscars: 'Karthikeya 2' actor Nikhil on 'RRR'
4.article_body: 'Karthikeya 2' actor Nikhil Siddhartha, speaking about 'RRR' being submitted to the Oscars for nominations, said the award isn't a certificate. "If you get an Oscar, good, but that shouldn't be the end...Not every film is made for the Oscars," he added. "We have our...National Awards, we have our...Filmfare Awards...many awards are given by our Indian Government," he stated.

5.title: Arsenal vs Leeds suspended for 40 mins due to stadium power surge
5.article_body: Arsenal FC's Premier League match against Leeds United was suspended for nearly 40 minutes after an electrical issue at the Elland Road stadium. A reported 'power surge' at kick-off led to VAR, referee communications and stadium lights being affected. The match was suspended after about three minutes of starting and players were asked to go back to their dressing rooms.

6.title: I enjoyed doing 'Liger', I shot with Mike Tyson: Director Puri Jagannadh
6.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh said he enjoyed doing 'Liger' with actor Vijay Deverakonda and actress Ananya Panday and building "beautiful" sets. "I shot with Mike Tyson," he added. Puri stated he can't cry over the film's failure for the next three years. "If I look back, the days I was happier are more than the days I was sad," he added.

7.title: Female passengers fight inside Mumbai local, pull each other's hair; video goes viral
7.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing female passengers fighting inside a Mumbai local. In the video, the women can be seen punching, slapping and pulling each other's hair. As per reports, the fight occurred between a woman and a mother and daughter duo over occupying a seat.

8.title: Namibia captain reacts to Sachin's tweet on their win vs SL, says 'Nam yaad rakhna'
8.article_body: After Sachin Tendulkar praised Namibia for defeating Sri Lanka in the T20 World Cup 2022 opener, writing, "Namibia...has told the cricketing world today...'Nam' yaad rakhna," Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus reacted to his tweet. Erasmus wrote, "Nam yaad rakhna!" Namibia defeated Sri Lanka by 55 runs in Geelong.

9.title: People think I'm sitting on pedestal trying to make, break careers: Johar
9.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, speaking about the misconceptions that people have about him, has said that people think that he is sitting on some pedestal trying to make and break careers. "I'm trying to struggle and survive as much as every other filmmaker. There are enough and more actors that keep saying no to us," he further stated.

10.title: Netherlands defeat UAE by 3 wickets in final-over thriller in T20 WC
10.article_body: Netherlands defeated UAE by three wickets in the final over in their first Group A match in T20 World Cup 2022 in Geelong on Sunday. Batting first, UAE managed 111/8 in 20 overs. Netherlands scored 112/7 in 19.5 overs. Maxwell O'Dowd top-scored for Netherlands with an 18-ball 23. Bas de Leede and Fred Klaassen took three and two wickets respectively.

11.title: Live sports gaming platform PlayCKC raises $200,000 in seed funding
11.article_body: Live sports gaming platform PlayCKC raised $200,000 in a seed funding round led by Freeflow Venture Builders and saw participation from high net worth individuals like Sanjay Nagi and Sharan Parikh. It was founded in 2020 by Swapnil Manish, Anuradha Sinha and Sanket Khemuka. PlayCKC was among four startups in the first sports-tech cohort by India Accelerator and JSW Sports.

12.title: Indian men's 10m air rifle team wins gold at World Shooting Championship
12.article_body: Indian men's 10m air rifle team of Rudrankksh Patil, Arjun Babuta and Kiran Jadhav won the country's fifth gold medal at ISSF World Shooting Championship in Cairo on Sunday. India beat China 16-10 in the gold medal match. Meanwhile, Indian women's 10m air rifle team of Mehuli Ghosh, Elavenil Valarivan and Meghana Sajjanar won bronze medal after defeating Germany 17-11.

13.title: Tiger roaming in Bhopal college campus since 1 week captured
13.article_body: A tiger that had entered the Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology's sprawling campus in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal about a week ago was captured on Sunday, a forest official said. "It walked into one of the three cages put up with baits on the campus. We're going to release the feline in Satpura Tiger Reserve in Narmadapuram," Bhopal DFO said.

14.title: 4 dead, 61 injured in Tehran prison fire: Iranian authorities
14.article_body: Four prisoners were killed and 61 others were injured in the fire that broke out at Tehran's Evin prison on Saturday, Iranian authorities said on Sunday. According to authorities, the fire started after a prison workshop was set ablaze following "a fight among a number of prisoners". Evin reportedly holds many detainees facing security charges, including Iranians with dual nationality.

15.title: Netflix launches 'Basic with Ads' plan with 15 to 30-second-long ads
15.article_body: Netflix has launched a new "Basic with Ads" plan in 12 countries including the US, the UK, Australia, France and Canada. This is Netflix's most affordable monthly plan yet and comes with certain compromises, along with ads. The plan will be available starting November. The ads will last 15-30 seconds and play before and during shows and films.

16.title: U'khand Police on alert as letter threatens to blow up temples
16.article_body: Uttarakhand Police and intelligence agencies have gone on alert after a letter threatened to blow up religious places, including Kedarnath and Badrinath, and railway stations on October 25 and 27. The letter was sent to Haridwar railway station by ordinary post. The writer claimed to be affiliated with Jaish-e-Mohammed and vowed to avenge killing of "jihadis" in Jammu and Kashmir.

17.title: Arjun shares 1st look of Parineeti from 'Uunchai', actress calls him 'asli dost'
17.article_body: Arjun Kapoor on Sunday shared the first look poster of Parineeti Chopra from 'Uunchai'. He wrote, "She was my first heroine and this is her first #Rajshri film...This one is for you Pari!" Parineeti wrote on her Instagram Stories that Arjun launching her poster wasn't a surprise but a "shock" and called him her "sach ka, asli dost (true friend)".

18.title: IBM's Client Innovation Center inaugurated in Odisha by CM Patnaik
18.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik inaugurated IBM's Client Innovation Center (CIC) in Bhubaneswar. Speaking at the inauguration, Patnaik called it a "watershed moment, signifying the fast changing IT ecosystem in the state". He added that Odisha is now fast emerging as a technology resource hub. "Over the years, the resurgent Odisha has scripted success stories in many spheres," Patnaik said.

19.title: Sisodia is less Dy CM & more of Kejriwal's corruption collection agent: BJP
19.article_body: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia took a jibe at Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and called him a "corrupt collection agent" of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Bhatia added that Kejriwal should be ashamed of himself for comparing his Ministers with freedom fighters like Bhagat Singh, who sacrificed their lives for the country. He also alleged that AAP was doing "pressure politics".

20.title: I'll have no shame in taking advice of the Gandhi family: Kharge
20.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Mallikarjun Kharge has said that he'd have no shame in taking the advice of the Gandhi family in running the party affairs. "Sonia Gandhi...[and]...Rahul Gandhi...have done good for [India]...their advice will benefit the party," he said. Kharge was responding to allegations that he would be the remote control of the Gandhi family on becoming the AICC chief.

21.title: 2 refugee camp leaders killed by Rohingya mob in Bangladesh
21.article_body: Two Rohingya refugee camp leaders were lynched to death by a mob of over a dozen Rohingyas in Bangladesh on Saturday, police said. The Arakan Rohingya Salvation Army (ARSA), a group fighting the military in Myanmar, is believed to be behind the killings, an official cited by AFP said. "The internal clashes in Myanmar are impacting the...situation in...camps," he added.

22.title: 68 ATM cards seized after 5 arrested in Guwahati in ATM fraud case
22.article_body: Assam Police has arrested five persons in connection with two ATM fraud cases and has seized 68 ATM cards and three vehicles from them. The accused had fraudulently changed the ATM cards of unknown persons by offering to help them when they went to ATMs to withdraw money, police said. Later, they allegedly withdrew money from the victims' bank accounts.

23.title: Water supply to be disrupted in some parts of Pune for several days
23.article_body: Several parts of Pune will face a disruption in water supply over the next several days due to repair work on the water pipeline between Parvati Water Center and Cantonment Water Center. The city's civic body's Water Supply Department head Aniruddha Pawaskar said that water supply in Hadapsar, Cantonment area, Solapur Road, and Kondhwa neighbourhoods could be affected.

24.title: Putin's chief of Ukraine mobilisation found dead under 'suspicious circumstances'
24.article_body: Lieutenant Colonel Roman Malyk, the head of Russian President Vladimir Putin's Ukraine mobilisation campaign, has been found dead under 'mysterious circumstances', multiple reports said. The 49-year-old was reportedly found dead near a fence at his home. Russian police, who's started a murder probe, hasn't ruled out suicide with some reports saying Malyk died due to hanging.

25.title: Newly-built Suranjan Das Road in B'luru caves in, second incident in a week
25.article_body: A portion of Bengaluru's recently-built Suranjan Das Road has caved in, affecting traffic enroute to Bagmane Tech Park, DRDO and other workspaces. Officials of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike blamed heavy rains and said they've already begun fixing the issue. This is the second such incident in Bengaluru in a week after Kundalahalli underpass caved in on October 9.

26.title: Neighbour harassed her, hindered her marriage to another man: Police on Vaishali
26.article_body: Vaishali Takkar, the 29-year-old television actress who committed suicide at her house in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, was being harassed by her neighbour named Rahul, according to police. "She was about to get married to another man, but he hindered that too," Indore ACP M Rahman told ANI. Rahul is absconding and a search to nab him is underway.

27.title: Education in Hindi, mother tongue would stop 'brain drain': Shah
27.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that PM Narendra Modi turned "brain drain" into "brain gain" by enabling students to pursue medical and technical education in Hindi and other regional languages. "If education is imparted in their mother tongue, I have complete faith that they will reach great heights across the world," Shah said.

28.title: Hope girls play freely now in U-17 Women's WC: India head coach Dennerby
28.article_body: Indian Under-17 women's football team head coach Thomas Dennerby said he wants his side to start playing freely now as they've nothing to lose in FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup. Hosts India are already out of the World Cup having lost their first two group matches against the United States (0-8) and Morocco (0-3). India will face Brazil on Monday.

29.title: Mumbai man claims fake CBI officers kidnapped him in July, robbed him of ₹50 lakh
29.article_body: A 44-year-old businessman from Mumbai's Goregaon lodged a complaint alleging that he was kidnapped on July 1 by men claiming to be from the CBI, who also robbed ₹50 lakh from him. The businessman filed the complaint after Goregaon Police recently arrested four fake CBI officers. He said six to seven men, including one with an ‘ID card’, kidnapped him.

30.title: It means the world to me: Parineeti on being appreciated for 'Code...'
30.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra said that she's "extremely humbled" with the appreciation that she's getting for her performance in 'Code Name: Tiranga'. "I always wanted to do...action film and now that I'm being appreciated in this avatar, it means the world to me!" she added. Parineeti further said she has always believed in breaking the mould and in doing something new.

31.title: Pune Police uses dating app to nab woman accused of drugging dates
31.article_body: Pune Police used a dating app, Bumble, to nab a 27-year-old woman accused of drugging and robbing her dates in the city. The police tried tracing her through the app by making multiple profiles and some of them even matched with her, but she did not initiate any conversation. The woman had robbed 16 people in the last few months.

32.title: 2 Thane people cheat Hyd-based manufacturer of ₹18.25 lakh, booked
32.article_body: Two Thane people have been booked for allegedly cheating a Hyderabad-based manufacturer of hygiene products of ₹18.25 lakh, police said on Sunday. The accused placed an order for adult diapers worth the aforementioned amount and asked the victim to supply the same to their godown In Bhiwandi. The accused didn't pay after receiving the consignment, an official said.

33.title: Software engineer loses ₹6.33 lakh in online dating fraud in Thane
33.article_body: A 48-year-old software engineer allegedly lost ₹6.33 lakh in an online dating fraud in Maharashtra's Thane, police said. The man had received a message from a number offering online dating. When he called the number, the accused made him allegedly pay ₹6,33,626 on some pretext or other. Meanwhile, police have registered a case and launched an investigation into the matter.

34.title: Giant python found stuck in school bus engine in Raebareli; video surfaces
34.article_body: A massive python was found in the engine of a school bus in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli area on Sunday. In a video that has surfaced on social media, a man can be seen pulling the snake from the bottom of the bus with the help of a rope. The snake was rescued and no injuries were reported.

35.title: PMC asks Metro officials to repair roads damaged due to metro work
35.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) Commissioner Vikram Kumar asked Metro officials to repair potholes on city roads where metro construction is underway. Kumar also suggested that the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority should repair the damaged roads. Additional Municipal Commissioner Kunal Khemnar said that there is traffic congestion in the city due to various developmental works.

36.title: Vietnam's VinFast recalls a third of EVs it sold to replace sensors
36.article_body: Vietnamese EV-maker VinFast on Saturday said it would recall 730 of its model VF e34 EVs to make checks and replace their side crash sensors. "The side crash sensor...is likely to encounter an incompatibility error with the airbag controller...and...may send an incorrect signal to the controller," VinFast said. The firm has sold 2,208 EVs since its launch late last year.

37.title: Police constable shoots himself to death in Chhattisgarh
37.article_body: A police constable allegedly died by suicide by shooting himself with his service weapon at a police camp in Domikala village in Chhattisgarh's Mohla-Manpur-Ambagarh Chowki district on Sunday. The exact reason behind the death is yet to be ascertained, police said. The deceased, Vedram Raj, was a native of the Bilaspur district and his family lives in the Rajnandgaon district.

38.title: AIMIM's UP Prez booked for alleged remark against Hindu marriages
38.article_body: A case has been registered against AIMIM UP President Shaukat Ali for "disturbing communal harmony". During a private event, Ali allegedly said, "Yes, when we (Muslims) marry twice...you (Hindus) marry one woman and keep three mistresses that no one knows about." The police said strict action will be taken against any person making statements that disturb religious harmony.

39.title: Car falls off road in Uttarakhand's Tehri Garhwal; 2 killed
39.article_body: Two men were killed when their car fell off a mountain road in the Kandisaur area of the Tehri Garhwal district in Uttarakhand. The car fell nearly 200 metres down the Nagun-Suwakholi motor road late on Saturday night, an official said. The deceased, Akhil Bisht (28) and Ankit Rawat (25), were residents of the Uttarkashi district, he added.

40.title: 2,400-kg ganja tucked in drums seized by Assam Police, CM shares pics
40.article_body: The Assam Police seized 2,400 kg of ganja tucked inside drums from a truck along the Assam-Tripura border late on Saturday night. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma tweeted on the same and said, "Two accused apprehended. Excellent work." A few days earlier, Assam Police had seized 9.47 kg of heroin in Karimganj district and arrested one local.

41.title: Attempts to impose Hindi are impractical: Tamil Nadu CM writes to PM
41.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Sunday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi and said, "The aggressive attempts of the Union government to impose Hindi are impractical and divisive in character." Stalin added that the number of people speaking languages other than Hindi is numerically more than Hindi-speaking people in the Indian Union.

42.title: An editor once wrote that I mix my period blood in ladoos that I send on Diwali: Kangana
42.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories to recall the time when she was called a witch. "In 2016...one of the leading print editors wrote a piece...that her investigative [journalistic] skills...landed her proofs of my black magic skills and she's more than sure...I mix my period blood in ladoos that I send on Diwali to everyone as gifts," Kangana wrote.

43.title: Impressed with his action, Rohit asks 11-year-old boy to bowl to him; video goes viral
43.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma asking an 11-year-old boy named Drushil Chauhan to bowl to him. Team India Analyst Hari Prasad Mohan revealed Drushil's smooth action caught everyone's attention at Perth's WACA stadium when around 100 kids were playing there and Rohit identified him. Drushil bowled to Rohit and also got his autography.

44.title: World can't afford India to follow China's manufacturing path: Raghuram Rajan
44.article_body: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan in a recent speech batted for a services-led export model for India, instead of following China's manufacturing-led export model. "Export-led services growth will be much less environmentally harmful – the world cannot afford India to follow China's path, even if it were open to it," he added.

45.title: Randeep Hooda lost 18 kg to play Savarkar, wanted to lose more: Producer
45.article_body: 'SwatantryaVeer Savarkar' producer Anand Pandit revealed that actor Randeep Hooda lost 18 kg to play the role of freedom fighter Vinayak Damodar Savarkar. "He wanted to shed a few more to look the part. We discussed the idea of making him look leaner in the post-production, but eventually decided to go with his decision," he added.

46.title: Italian insulted PM, now Italia insults his mother: Anurag Thakur
46.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur said an "Italian woman" used to "insult" PM Modi and now an "Italia" is insulting his mother, in a reported reference to Sonia Gandhi and AAP leader Gopal Italia. "Gujarat did not accept this insult earlier, it will not accept it now," added Thakur. He said the BJP was going to win 400-plus seats in 2024.

47.title: People at God's mercy in UP, will be called baaghi if we raise voice: BJP MP
47.article_body: BJP MP from UP's Kaiserganj, Brijbhushan Sharan Singh, said people in areas affected by flooding have been left "bhagwan bharose (at god's mercy)". Singh said he couldn't express how he felt for fear of being labelled a "baaghi (rebel)" and that there wasn't any scope for criticism anymore. Never saw such poor preparations for flood control and relief, Singh added.

48.title: About 3,000 mangroves to be saved by removing bunds in Navi Mumbai
48.article_body: The Maharashtra Forest Department has begun removing manmade bunds (embankments) that were blocking water flow to mangroves in Navi Mumbai. This will reportedly save around 3,000 mangroves. "Work at Kamothe was completed. At Kharghar, the periphery was cleared by an excavator, four staffers and four labourers, partially restoring tidal water flow. A large portion still remains," said an official.

49.title: Jaya Bachchan tells media person 'I hope you fall'; video surfaces
49.article_body: A video has surfaced on the internet showing actress and politician Jaya Bachchan telling a media person, who reportedly took a tumble, "Serves you well. I hope you...fall." The video also showed her asking the paparazzi, "Who are you? From media house do you belong to?" The video was reportedly taken at the Lakme Fashion Week in Mumbai.

50.title: Got validation as actress after working with Big B, Aamir, Dhanush: AvrRam
50.article_body: Elli AvrRam has said that she got validation as an actress after working with "critically-acclaimed actors" like Aamir Khan, Dhanush and Amitabh Bachchan. Speaking about featuring in Amitabh's film 'Goodbye', AvrRam said, "It feels amazing to get to share the big screen with our legend, Amitabh Bachchan. It's, to be honest, surreal and unbelievable still."

51.title: Donetsk mayor's office hit by Ukrainian shelling: Pro-Russia officials
51.article_body: Ukrainian shelling on Sunday morning damaged the mayor's office in the city of Donetsk, the capital of the Donetsk region, Moscow-backed authorities said. The main entry into the building was hit and several nearby cars were damaged, the authorities added. There were no immediate reports of casualties. Moscow-backed authorities seized control of Donetsk city from Ukraine in 2014.

52.title: Govt owes an answer to India: NCP on fall in global hunger ranking
52.article_body: NCP on Saturday criticised the government after India slipped six places on Global Hunger Index 2022 to take 107th position out of 121 countries ranked. NCP Spokesperson Clyde Crasto said this ranking indicates that the Central government neglected the development of children over the last eight years. "The government owes an answer to India on this sensitive issue," he added.

53.title: Regasa, Cheptai win elite races at Delhi Half Marathon, Sable fastest Indian
53.article_body: Ethiopia's Chala Regasa won the men's elite race at Vedanta Delhi Half Marathon, with a timing of one hour 30 seconds, on Sunday. Kenya's Irene Chepet Cheptai clocked a personal best of 1:06:42 to top the women's event. Steeple-chaser Avinash Sable won the Indian men's elite race by 0.04 seconds ahead of Kartik Kumar. Both Sable and Kartik clocked 1:04:00.

54.title: 2 African nationals cheat women on social media in Hyd; arrested
54.article_body: Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police on Sunday arrested two African nationals from Delhi for allegedly cheating women on social media. One of the accused befriended the victims and told them that he would send gold and electronic gadgets in a parcel. The other accused introduced himself as an official from the customs department and asked the victims to pay customs tax.

55.title: 4 injured after getting electrocuted during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K'taka
55.article_body: Four people participating in Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra sustained injuries after getting electrocuted in Karnataka on Sunday. "Today, an unfortunate incident happened during the yatra when four of our friends got a minor electric shock on account of a pole touching the wire," said Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala. The injured will be compensated with ₹1 lakh.

56.title: Siblings stabbed by 2 drunk men in Delhi's Dwarka; 1 dead
56.article_body: A 33-year-old man was stabbed to death while his brother sustained grievous injuries after they were attacked allegedly by two drunk men in Dwarka, Delhi. The deceased has been identified as Lohit while his brother, Anil (32), is undergoing treatment at a hospital, police said. The accused, Rohin (30) and Varun (25), have been arrested, police added.

57.title: KRK shares video of Hrithik Roshan's 'bald patch', actor's fans react
57.article_body: Film critic Kamaal Rashid Khan aka KRK took to Twitter to share a video from a wedding, where Hrithik Roshan appeared as a guest. A part of the video showed a bald patch on Hrithik's head. "When #HrithikRoshan [forgot] to wear...hair patch," KRK wrote. Several fans defended Hrithik, with one writing, "He went through...brain surgery...Stop making fun of a legend."

58.title: Someone other than Rohit should get role of increasing run-rate: Klusener
58.article_body: Ex-South Africa all-rounder Lance Klusener said India should assign the role of increasing run-rate in powerplay to someone other than Rohit Sharma. "There's no need for Rohit to go faster. He was playing easily fast enough, aggressive enough and well enough...not to have changed," Klusener added. India will open their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign against Pakistan on October 23.

59.title: China will enact policies to boost birth rates: Xi at CCP meet
59.article_body: China will implement policies to boost its birth rates and "pursue a proactive national strategy in response to population ageing", President Xi Jinping said at the opening of the CCP's 20th National Congress on Sunday. According to demographers, China is set to register record-low births this year. Last year, China saw an 11.5% drop in births in comparison to 2020

60.title: Congress would win over 150 Assembly seats in K'taka polls: Shivakumar
60.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar exuded confidence that the party would win the state Assembly elections and claimed that it would get over 150 seats. "Our people are suffering economically. The youngsters are suffering without jobs. The kids, farmers and women are all meeting us. They are coming to Rahul Gandhi and telling [him] about their grievances," said Shivakumar.

61.title: Man brutally thrashed in Bhiwandi on suspicion of being a child-lifter
61.article_body: A man was brutally beaten up by locals on suspicion of being a child lifter in Bhiwandi near Mumbai. A video of the incident surfaced online. Reports said that the man entered a house and was talking to a young boy when locals caught him and started beating him after suspecting that he was a child lifter.

62.title: Tripura forest department to use radio collars to track elephant movement
62.article_body: As a part of its efforts to reduce man-animal conflicts, Tripura forest department decided to use GPS-enabled devices to track elephants' movement, Deputy Chief Wildlife Warden KG Roy said. A Bengaluru-based company has been entrusted with the task of fitting radio collars around the neck of elephants. At least 50 incidents of man-elephant conflict were recorded in Tripura since 2019.

63.title: Warner will definitely play vs NZ, not sure about warm-up vs India: Finch
63.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has said opener David Warner is unlikely to play against India in their warm-up match on Monday in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "I think Warner will definitely be right for New Zealand," added Finch. Warner suffered whiplash (a neck injury) in the second England T20I after he landed awkwardly while attempting a catch.

64.title: World no. 1 Swiatek reaches her 9th final of 2022 at San Diego Open
64.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek reached her ninth final of the season after beating fourth-seeded Jessie Pegula 4-6, 6-2, 6-2 in San Diego Open semi-final. This is the 21-year-old's 63rd win of 2022. Swiatek will become the fourth woman to finish the year with more than 10,000 points in WTA Tour rankings, after Victoria Azarenka, Maria Sharapova and Serena Williams.

65.title: Muslim man in B'luru arrested in first case under K'taka anti-conversion law
65.article_body: A Muslim man in Bengaluru has been arrested in the first case under Karnataka Protection of Right to Freedom of Religion Act. The case was filed on October 6 over a complaint by a 19-year-old girl's mother that her daughter was converted to another religion by the accused on pretext of marriage. The girl had gone missing on October 5.

66.title: John announces wrap on 'Tehran', calls it 'wonderful experience'
66.article_body: Actor John Abraham took to Instagram to share that shooting of his film 'Tehran' has been completed. "Thank you to the entire team for making it such a wonderful shoot experience. Can't wait to bring this one to you," he wrote. The action-thriller film, directed by Arun Gopalan, will be released in 2023. It also stars Manushi Chhillar.

67.title: People are finally recognising us: 'Kantara' director on Kannada cinema
67.article_body: 'Kantara' director Rishab Shetty said people are "finally recognising" the Kannada film industry, and he credits the success of films like 'KGF', which "created a new path for the filmmakers" to explore. Rishab said Kantara's success proves that the audience has started looking at cinema from a different perspective. "The entire world accepted the film so wonderfully," Rishab added.

68.title: AAP has broken records of corruption set by Congress: JP Nadda
68.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda claimed that the AAP government has become synonymous with scams and has broken the records of corruption set by the Congress. "The AAP has become a party of scams...It needs to be packed off lock, stock and barrel," said Nadda. He also stated that the BJP will trounce the AAP in the MCD polls.

69.title: AAP has broken records of corruption set by Congress: Nadda
69.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday said AAP government in Delhi has become synonymous with scams and broken records of corruption set by Congress. "When other political parties chose video conferences, BJP workers committed themselves to serve people during the COVID-19 pandemic," Nadda added. "PM Narendra Modi has realised goal of 'sabka sath, sabka vikas, sabka vishwas'," he stated.

70.title: Mumbai woman killed by speeding autorickshaw while returning home
70.article_body: A woman, who was returning home after buying vegetables, was killed after a speeding autorickshaw knocked her down on a busy road in Mumbai, police said on Sunday. The accused escaped from the spot but was caught by some locals and was handed over to the police, an official said, adding that the locals took the woman to the hospital.

71.title: Driver arrested for riding auto on Kurla railway station platform in Mumbai
71.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was arrested by Mumbai Police after he entered the platform of Kurla railway station with his three-wheeler. The police arrested the driver after a Twitter user shared video of the incident and tagged Mumbai Traffic Police in the post, requesting action against him. The accused was produced in court and punished under relevant sections of Railway Act.

72.title: 2 injured as Punjab Minister Baljit Kaur's escort vehicle hits scooter
72.article_body: A man and his female colleague were injured after being hit by a speeding escort vehicle of Punjab Cabinet Minister Dr Baljit Kaur in Chandigarh on Saturday. They were crossing the Sector 27/28 light point on a scooter when the accident took place. The minister visited the injured man at a hospital and assured his parents of full cooperation.

73.title: 153 properties sealed in Pimpri Chinchwad for defaulting on property tax
73.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) sealed 153 properties, including 40 residential flats, for non-payment of taxes. Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nilesh Deshmukh said that after the properties were sealed, some owners paid taxes and dues of over ₹3 crore were collected. Deshmukh added that if pending taxes are not cleared in 21 days, the properties will be auctioned.

74.title: India allows exports of wheat flour produced from imported wheat
74.article_body: The Indian government has passed an order allowing export-oriented units and firms set up in Special Economic Zones to export flour made from imported wheat. According to the order, India will import duty-free wheat against a commitment to export flour. India had restricted wheat flour exports in August to keep the price hikes in check.

75.title: US economy strong as hell, I'm concerned about rest of the world: Biden
75.article_body: US President Joe Biden said, "Our economy is strong as hell - the internals of it. Inflation is worldwide. It's worse off everywhere else than it is in the United States." On the soaring US dollar, he said, "I'm not concerned about the strength of the dollar. I'm concerned about the rest of the world."

76.title: 140 was good score in 2007 T20 WC, now people get that in 14 overs: Rohit
76.article_body: Indian skipper Rohit Sharma remembered the first-ever T20 World Cup in 2007 in which he made his T20I debut. "When I was picked for that WC I did not go with any expectations about myself," Rohit said. He added, "140 or 150 was a good score back then and now people try and get that score in 14-15 overs."

77.title: He's today's Bhagat Singh: Kejriwal after AAP says Sisodia will be arrested
77.article_body: After the Aam Aadmi Party said that Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia would be arrested by the CBI, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said that Sisodia and Satyendar Jain are today's Bhagat Singh. "Prison bars and the threat of noose could never deter the spirit of Bhagat Singh. This is the second fight for freedom," he added.

78.title: Uber responds after actress Manava says driver threatened her, calls it 'deplorable'
78.article_body: Uber responded after actress Manava Naik alleged that a Mumbai driver misbehaved with her and threatened her with dire consequences. Calling the incident "deplorable", Uber said it has removed the driver's access to their app. Further, Mumbai Joint Commissioner of Police (Law and Order) said they have taken serious cognisance of the incident and the culprit will be booked soon.

79.title: Daryl Mitchell is unlikely to be available for game vs Australia: Coach Stead
79.article_body: New Zealand head coach Gary Stead has said their all-rounder Daryl Mitchell is unlikely to be available for their opening game in the T20 World Cup against Australia on October 22. "It's more likely the second game, this is what we're targeting," added Stead. Mitchell had fractured his finger ahead of the Tri-Series involving Bangladesh and Pakistan earlier this month.

80.title: 'Phone banking' to 'digital banking' shift put India on sustained growth path: PM
80.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said India has achieved sustained growth by replacing 'phone banking' with 'digital banking'. PM Modi dedicated 75 Digital Banking Units (DBUs) to the nation. PM Modi stated that under 'phone banking', instructions were given on phone to banks regarding whom they had to lend to and at what terms and conditions.

81.title: Centre not ready to accept figures: Yechury on Global Hunger Index
81.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury criticised the Centre over India's poor ranking in the Global Hunger Index and alleged that the government is not ready to accept the figures. "Crores of people have become poor who were not poor before COVID, but instead of giving relief to them, the Centre is busy giving tax relief to the rich," said Yechury.

82.title: Will start engineering and polytechnic studies in Hindi: Shivraj Singh
82.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has confirmed that the state government will start educating engineering as well as polytechnic students in Hindi soon. "We will free education completely from English. Whoever wants to study (in English) can study, there is no compulsion...It is our dream to start education in Hindi at IITs and IIMs," said Shivraj.

83.title: Sisodia will be arrested tomorrow: AAP over CBI summon in excise policy scam
83.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM and AAP leader Manish Sisodia will be arrested tomorrow (Monday), the party said on Sunday as CBI summoned him in the Delhi excise policy scam. "CBI and ED have raided at least 500 different places and found nothing. Everyone can understand...it has nothing to do with excise policy but with Gujarat elections," said AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj.

84.title: It's something I'd be open to: Cummins on sharing ODI captaincy with Warner
84.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins has suggested that he's ready to be Australia ODI captain on a rotational basis, sharing the responsibility with David Warner. "(It is) something I'd be open to...Playing every single game isn't realistic," he added. "Warner be awesome at [captaincy]...He's a leader [in] our group. Always has been, always will be," Cummins further said.

85.title: Deputy Superintendent in Hyderabad loses ₹1 lakh in cyber fraud
85.article_body: The Deputy Superintendent of Hyderabad's Cherlapally jail was cheated of ₹1 lakh by cyber fraudsters. The fraudster, impersonating Delhi's cybercrime officer, told the victim that an obscene video featuring him was viral on YouTube. He asked the victim to contact a person named Rahul Sharma, who would delete his videos. Sharma demanded money from the victim and cheated him.

86.title: Delhi man kills 70-yr-old for not giving money to buy liquor; held
86.article_body: A vagabond allegedly killed a 70-year-old tea stall owner in Delhi after he refused to give him money to consume liquor, police said. The 44-year-old accused, who used to keep his money with the victim, hit him on his head with a stick when he was asleep. Police have arrested the accused with the help of over 30 CCTV footages.

87.title: Sonakshi & I share an absolutely platonic friendship: Zaheer Iqbal
87.article_body: Actor Zaheer Iqbal said he shares "an absolutely platonic friendship" with Sonakshi Sinha and that their dating rumours "started with a prank". Zaheer will be seen sharing screen space with Sonakshi in 'Double XL'. Talking about working with his "best friend", Zaheer said, "Working with Sonakshi in every possible way has been one of the best experiences of my life."

88.title: Producers didn't want to work with me after wedding rumours with Mehmood: Aruna
88.article_body: Actress Aruna Irani in an interview opened up about the rumours of her wedding with actor-filmmaker Mehmood. She said, "I don't know how that rumour started...No producer was ready to work with me." Aruna added, "Dada Kondke (actor and producer) offered me a song in his Marathi film 'Andhala Maarto Dola'. That's how I started working again."

89.title: 16-yr-old Aayan Afzal Khan becomes youngest cricketer to play in T20 World Cup history
89.article_body: UAE all-rounder Aayan Afzal Khan on Sunday became the youngest-ever cricketer to feature in a men's T20 World Cup match, achieving the feat during his team's match against Netherlands in Geelong. Aayan set the record at the age of 16 years and 335 days. The previous record was held by Pakistan fast bowler Mohammad Amir (17 years and 55 days).

90.title: Akhilesh to fund studies of boy who ran away from home to attend Mulayam's funeral
90.article_body: After a 10-year-old boy claimed that he ran away from his home to pay tributes to SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav in UP's Saifai, party chief Akhilesh Yadav has announced to fund his studies. "[Akhilesh] has also called this child again after a few days," a party leader said. The video of the boy's interaction with railway police went viral.

91.title: Magician OP Sharma, who performed in over 36,000 shows, passes away
91.article_body: Indian magician OP Sharma, who performed in more than 36,000 shows, has passed away. He died after a prolonged illness at a hospital in Kanpur on Saturday night. He was in his eighties. He started performing magic at the age of five. OP Sharma grew up in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district and did his engineering from Kanpur.

92.title: Afghanistan can beat anyone anytime, they've good bowling line-up: Aakash
92.article_body: Ahead of Afghanistan's upcoming match against England in T20 World Cup 2022, Aakash Chopra said that Afghanistan can beat anyone anytime. "If we talk about their strengths, this team has a good bowling line-up. They've three spinners, they want to stifle you, whether it's Mujeeb Ur Rahman, Rashid Khan or Mohammad Nabi," he added. Match will be played on Saturday.

93.title: BJP to hold CEC meet for Himachal Pradesh polls on Tuesday: Reports
93.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, the BJP is likely to hold a meeting of the Central Election Committee (CEC) on Tuesday to finalise the candidates. Earlier on Saturday, Union Home Minister Amit Shah launched the party's campaign song "Himachal Ki Pukar Fir BJP ki Sarkar" for the elections. The state will go to polls on November 12.

94.title: Prez Murmu undergoes cataract surgery at Delhi's Army Hospital
94.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu underwent cataract surgery at the Army Hospital in Delhi on Sunday, a Rashtrapati Bhavan spokesperson said. The surgery was successful and she has been discharged from the hospital, the spokesperson said. The surgery was carried out by a team of doctors led by Brigadier Sanjay Kumar Mishra, who had last year operated former President Ram Nath Kovind.

95.title: Nayanthara-Vignesh got legally married 6 years ago, surrogate a relative: Report
95.article_body: Actress Nayanthara and her filmmaker-husband Vignesh Shivan, who tied the knot in a ceremony in June this year, legally registered their marriage six years ago, reports citing an affidavit claimed. The couple announced the birth of their twin boys earlier this month and are facing a probe over surrogacy. According to the affidavit, Nayanthara's relative was the surrogate mother.

96.title: India aims for crypto SOPs during G20 presidency: Sitharaman
96.article_body: Stating that all countries want cryptocurrency to not be misutilised, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that during its G20 presidency, India is aiming to develop standard operating procedures (SOPs) for cryptocurrency. Sitharaman said that she wants G20 countries to develop a technology-driven regulatory framework. She added that individually no country can effectively regulate crypto.

97.title: We are not dead, we are just turning 30: Cartoon Network
97.article_body: Cartoon Network's official Twitter account tweeted, "Y'all we're not dead, we're just turning 30." The channel's clarification came after reports said Warner Bros. Animation and Cartoon Network Studios would be merged, following which fans assumed Cartoon Network would be shut down. Several people shared their memories of Cartoon Network and #RIPCartoonNetwork was trending on Twitter.

98.title: 2 Ugandan districts put under 3-week lockdown amid Ebola outbreak
98.article_body: The Ugandan government has announced a three-week lockdown and curfew in two districts, Mubende and Kassanda, amid an outbreak of Ebola cases. The country's President Yoweri Museveni on Saturday said that a total of 19 people have died from the disease and there are 58 confirmed cases. He added that 20 people have recovered from the disease so far.

99.title: Foreign investors withdraw ₹7,500 crore from Indian equities in October
99.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have withdrawn about ₹7,500 crore in the first two weeks of October amid concerns about rate hikes in the US and the falling value of the Rupee. Data from depositories showed that FPIs had withdrawn ₹1.76 lakh crore in total in 2022. Apart from equities, FPIs have withdrawn ₹2,079 crore from the debt market in October.

100.title: Gandhi's grandson breaks down while talking on Nehru, says 'Filthy lies spread about him'
100.article_body: Historian and Mahatma Gandhi's grandson Rajmohan Gandhi broke down while talking about India's first PM Jawaharlal Nehru at Khushwant Singh Litfest in Kasauli. "You can criticise the policies of Nehru, but don't stoop low by spreading filthy lies about a nobleman," he said. "Nehru loved the Himalayas. The Himalayas would protest and the earth would protest too," he added.

101.title: 200 people migrate to Mumbai daily: CEO of Dharavi redevelopment
101.article_body: Daily over 200 people migrate to Mumbai, of which 70% are intra-state migrants, said CEO of Dharavi redevelopment project SVR Srinivas. There is a need to create effective rental housing schemes in the city due to the large influx of migrants, he added. If Dharavi and Govandi slums are taken care of, Mumbai will definitely become slum-free, he further said.

102.title: 6 of top 10 most valued firms lose ₹78,163 cr in m-cap; RIL loses most
102.article_body: Combined market capitalisation (m-cap) of six of the top 10 most valued firms fell by ₹78,163 crore in the last week as 30-share Sensex index declined 271.32 points. Reliance Industries' m-cap fell the most, falling ₹42,113.47 crore to ₹16.04 lakh crore. Reliance was followed by Bharti Airtel, losing ₹15,159.81 crore in m-cap, and ICICI Bank, losing ₹8,272.37 crore in m-cap.

103.title: It's been a historic day for us: Erasmus on Namibia's win vs SL in T20 WC
103.article_body: Following Namibia's 55-run win against Sri Lanka in Group A match in T20 World Cup, Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus said, "It's been a historic day for us." He added, "Opening day has been quite special but we want to kick on from here and qualify for...Super 12 stage." Chasing 164, Sri Lanka were bowled out for 108 in 19 overs.

104.title: 8,300 kgs of banned firecrackers seized from warehouse near Gurugram
104.article_body: Officials from the Haryana Chief Minister's flying squad seized 8,343 kilograms of traditional firecrackers from a warehouse in Dabodha village in Gurugram's Farrukhnagar. This consignment of banned crackers has been the largest ever to be seized in Haryana, officials said. The consignment was brought from Sivakasi in Tamil Nadu and the estimated price of the seized firecrackers at ₹1 crore.

105.title: Prithviraj's first look from Prabhas-starrer 'Salaar' revealed
105.article_body: Prashanth Neel, director of the upcoming movie 'Salaar', on Sunday shared a poster revealing Prithviraj Sukumaran's first look from the film. The filmmaker shared the poster on the occasion of Prithviraj's birthday. "Birthday Wishes to the most versatile Prithviraj. Presenting 'Vardharaja Mannaar' from #Salaar," Prashanth wrote. The action-thriller film will also feature Prabhas and Shruti Haasan.

106.title: We had big names in the last year's WC, but we didn't qualify: Pooran
106.article_body: With as many as 12 players, who featured in their last year's World Cup squad missing from their current squad for the 2022 T20 World Cup, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran has said the presence of "big names" doesn't guarantee success. "A lot of guys [in WI's squad] haven't played in Australia...but the guys are confident, they're happy," he added.

107.title: 67-yr-old businessman abducted from UP’s Bulandshahr rescued within 24 hrs
107.article_body: A 67-year-old businessman, who was allegedly abducted when he was out on a morning walk in UP’s Bulandshahr, was traced and rescued within 24 hours, police said on Sunday. "During questioning, he said his abductors left him and fled after they saw police checking vehicles...We have got certain clues and our teams are working on it," SSP Shlok Kumar said.

108.title: Necessary for independent-minded countries to speak their minds: EAM
108.article_body: While interacting with the Indian diaspora in Egypt, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar expressed concern over the struggle of countries thriving in a polarised world. "It is necessary for independent-minded countries to speak their minds...Richer countries are not fully grasping how poorer countries are being hurt by what's happening in the world," said Jaishankar.

109.title: Paddington bears left as tribute for Queen Elizabeth to be donated
109.article_body: Over 1,000 Paddington bears and other teddy bears left as a tribute to the late Queen Elizabeth II will be donated to a children's charity, Buckingham Palace said on Saturday. The Queen was linked to the children's literary character Paddington after they both appeared in a video together during Platinum Jubilee celebrations to mark her 70 years of service.

110.title: Alia Bhatt is fabulous performer; her ease, prep is incredible: Sidharth
110.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra has called actress Alia Bhatt a fabulous performer. Earlier, Sidharth was rumoured to be dating Alia before she tied the knot. "She makes you believe that it is all coming in very easily but she does her homework. I think her ease, her prep work [is incredible]," Sidharth added. The actor will next feature in 'Thank God'.

111.title: BJP shares parody video mocking Rahul, says ‘why doesn’t suffering end mommy?’
111.article_body: BJP on Sunday shared a parody video mocking Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Mommy, why doesn't this suffering end?" BJP tweeted, taking a jibe at Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi. The video touches upon several issues that Congress faced recently, including the resignation of leaders in J&K following Ghulam Nabi Azad.

112.title: Stuck for 4 yrs, Gurugram's master road to be completed in 3 months: GMDA
112.article_body: Gurugram's master road dividing Sectors 77,78 and 79 would be completed in the next three months, the Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority said. The project was allotted in 2018 but work got delayed on multiple occasions. A 3.35 km-long main carriageway of the road is being constructed which will benefit over 10,000 residents living in the above sectors, officials said.

113.title: Kiara never lets stardom or the noise around get to her: Sidharth
113.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said his 'Shershaah' co-star and rumoured girlfriend Kiara Advani "has great innocence" on screen and she "never lets the stardom or all the noise around get to her". "As to how she remains that simple girl is something that you can learn from her," he added. Sidharth will be next seen in Indra Kumar's 'Thank God'.

114.title: US soldiers testing Microsoft's goggles get nausea, headaches: Report
114.article_body: US soldiers testing Microsoft's new goggles for the Army suffered "mission-affecting physical impairments" including headaches and nausea, Bloomberg reported citing Pentagon's summary. One soldier reportedly said, "The devices would have gotten us killed." The defense department's testing director Nickolas Guertin said the system is "experiencing too many failures of essential functions".

115.title: There will be a few more upsets: Gibbs after SL's loss vs Namibia
115.article_body: Responding to a question on Twitter, ex-South Africa batter Herschelle Gibbs said there will be a "few more" upsets in the T20 World Cup 2022 following Sri Lanka's loss against Namibia. "Conditions in Australia...give everyone a real chance," added Gibbs in his tweet. Namibia posted a total of 163/7 with Sri Lanka bowled out for 108 in 19 overs.

116.title: There's not just SpaceX: US as startup seeks funding for Starlink in Ukraine
116.article_body: Pentagon's deputy press secretary Sabrina Singh confirmed being in touch with SpaceX after it sought funding for Starlink in Ukraine, adding, "There's not just SpaceX, there are other entities that we can...partner with when it comes to providing Ukraine with what they need on the battlefield." Earlier, SpaceX said it can no longer donate or fund Starlink terminals for Ukraine.

117.title: Rahul to vote at Bharat Jodo Yatra campsite in K’taka for Cong chief poll
117.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who is currently in Karnataka as part of Bharat Jodo Yatra, will be voting for Congress Presidential election from a campsite in Ballari along with 40 other delegates who are a part of the yatra, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said. The election for Congress party Presidential post is set to take place on Monday, October 17.

118.title: UP man kills wife & daughter, says, 'Child's face didn't match with his'
118.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly killing his 25-year-old wife and one-year-old daughter on suspicion of infidelity in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. The accused has reportedly confessed to the crime and said that "he suspected that his daughter did not belong to him as her face didn't match with his". According to police, the couple used to have frequent quarrels.

119.title: Special trains to run from Secunderabad during festive season
119.article_body: The South Central Railway (SCR) will run special trains from Secunderabad during the festive season. The special services include Secunderabad-Tirupati on October 19, Tirupati-Secunderabad on October 20, Secunderabad-Santragachi on October 21, Santragachi-Secunderabad on October 22 and Narsapur-Secunderabad on October 18. The trains will have 2AC, Sleeper and General Second Class coaches.

120.title: Nigerian students leave Gurugram university after fight with local students
120.article_body: A group of 50-60 Nigerian students at Gurugram's GD Goenka University have "temporarily" left their campus after some were allegedly thrashed and threatened by Indian students while playing football. Police have registered cross FIRs against each group of students for allegedly assaulting each other. Local people attacked international students with different weapons, reads one of the FIRs.

121.title: Govt to extend ₹35,000 crore to seven sectors in next PLI round: Report
121.article_body: According to an official, the government is planning to extend ₹35,000 crore Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme to seven different sectors with an aim to boost domestic manufacturing and create jobs. These sectors consist of five new sectors, toys, bicycles, leather & footwear, critical intermediates for chemicals and containers, and two existing sectors: IT hardware and pharma.

122.title: Ukraine's Kharkiv Art Museum to preserve art collection using NFTs
122.article_body: Kharkiv Art Museum (KAM) in Ukraine on October 13 said the Binance NFT market now stocks 15 works of art from the museum's Art without Borders collection. As stated in the official announcement, the earnings from the project will be used to support the museum's operations. The NFT collection will also "preserve the cultural heritage of Ukraine", the announcement added.

123.title: Congress no longer a reliable party: AIUDF leader Rafiqul Islam
123.article_body: AIUDF General Secretary Rafiqul Islam said that since the Congress is no longer reliable, his party is preparing to contest the 2024 Lok Sabha polls alone. "In the last Assembly polls, Congress' seats went up only because of AIUDF. Shortly after the elections, it ended the alliance with the AIUDF," said Islam.

124.title: 19-yr-old smashes beer bottle on policeman's head in Pune; arrested
124.article_body: A 19-year-old was arrested for smashing a beer bottle on a 52-year-old traffic policeman's head in Pune on Saturday night. The officer was trying to ease traffic near Pune's MM Chowk area when the accused approached him and started hurling abuses before hitting him with a beer bottle. The accused threatened those who tried to help the officer.

125.title: They have told the world today 'Nam' yaad rakhna: Sachin as Namibia beat SL
125.article_body: Reacting to 14th-ranked Namibia defeating Sri Lanka by 55 runs in T20 World Cup 2022 opener, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Namibia has told the cricketing world today 'Nam' yaad rakhna!" Meanwhile, Mpumelelo Mbangwa tweeted, "What a win for Namibia and what start to the ICC Men's T20 World Cup!" Namibia posted a total of 163/7 and dismissed Sri Lanka for 108.

126.title: A student asked me if it's bad to want to be rich, I said it's not a sin: Anil Agarwal
126.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Founder Anil Agarwal in a LinkedIn post revealed that he was recently asked by a student if it is a bad thing to want to be rich. "I told him, no...making money is not a sin, but once you get there...there is no harm in slowing down and giving a lift to those who are walking," Agarwal said.

127.title: It's beyond what we thought: Namibia's Frylinck after beating SL
127.article_body: Talking about Namibia's win against Sri Lanka in the first match of T20 World Cup 2022, Namibia all-rounder Jan Frylinck, who was named as the Player of the Match, said, "I'm...speechless at the moment." "What we've...achieved is above what we thought we could do," added Frylinck. Reacting to the win, Namibia captain Gerhard Erasmus stated, "It's been a historic day."

128.title: Over 10,000 illegal liquor bottles crushed by road roller in Delhi
128.article_body: The Excise Department of the Delhi government on Saturday destroyed over 10,000 bottles containing 5,516 litres of smuggled liquor, officials said. The liquor bottles were spread on concrete stretches and a road roller was used to crush them, they said. "Seizure of liquor smuggled into Delhi and its destruction is a routine exercise," a senior Excise department official said.

129.title: 29-year-old TV actress Vaishali Takkar found dead at her home in Indore
129.article_body: TV actress Vaishali Takkar has passed away at the age of 29. She was found hanging at her home in Madhya Pradesh's Indore and a suicide note was also recovered from the spot, according to reports. She has acted in several Hindi shows, including 'Sasural Simar Ka', 'Super Sisters' and 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' among others.

130.title: They forced me to accept I was someone else: Noida man detained in Abu Dhabi
130.article_body: A Noida-based man named Praveen Kumar, who returned to the city after being wrongfully detained at the Abu Dhabi airport, said, "They kept me overnight, forced me to accept I was someone else." He was detained after his face matched with a 'wanted criminal' in a face recognition software. He was let go after the intervention by Indian authorities.

131.title: Amit Shah launches Hindi version of MBBS course books in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal
131.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday launched the Hindi version of MBBS books in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. Anatomy, Physiology and Biochemistry have been chosen to be studied in Hindi as of now. "It is a big day. For the first time in the country, medical education in Hindi will begin in Madhya Pradesh," state Medical Education Minister Vishvas Sarang said.

132.title: Doesn't matter who wins, party should win: Tharoor on Cong chief poll
132.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor said it doesn't matter who wins the poll but the party should win. "Doesn't matter if Kharge sahab wins or I win. Congress should win as it's a party of inclusive India," Tharoor added. "We're the only party that wants everyone to be with us, irrespective of religion, gender, language, region...state," he stated.

133.title: Janhvi just started her journey, don't compare her & Sridevi: Boney
133.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor said people shouldn't draw comparisons between Janhvi and Sridevi's work as the former has "just started her journey" as an actor. He added that Janhvi "perhaps carries" Sridevi's DNA in terms of getting into the skin of her characters. "Which is why you've seen the growth she's done in the films so far," he said about Janhvi.

134.title: You're no Deepti: Ganesh on Starc taking her name while giving mankad warning
134.article_body: Talking about a video where Mitchell Starc gave a 'mankad' warning to Jos Buttler by saying, "I'm not Deepti, but I won't do it", ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh tweeted, "You are no Deepti Sharma." "You can never be Deepti," added Ganesh in his tweet. Ex-India cricketer Hemang Badani had earlier termed Starc's gesture as "really poor" in a tweet.

135.title: Man fakes kidnapping to extort family to buy car in Delhi; arrested
135.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly faking his kidnapping to extort money from his family in Delhi as he wanted to buy a car, police said. The accused called his family and told them that some people abducted him and were asking for a ransom of ₹2 lakh, according to police. The family has filed a case against the accused.

136.title: Xi Jinping says China will not renounce right to use force over Taiwan, it responds
136.article_body: China will never renounce the right to use force to resolve the Taiwan issue but will strive for a peaceful resolution, President Xi Jinping said on Sunday. "The complete reunification of the motherland must be achieved," he added. Taiwan responded by saying that it will not back down on its sovereignty or compromise on freedom and democracy.

137.title: We got a good team, it's about the process: Dasun after loss to Namibia
137.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation after their 55-run defeat against Namibia in the T20 World Cup, Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka said, "We didn't execute well with the ball. Didn't bowl in the right areas and that's a concern." He added, "We need not do anything special. We got a good team, it's about the process."

138.title: Ex-Punjab minister held for bribing officer to settle cases against him
138.article_body: Former minister Sunder Sham Arora has been arrested by the Punjab Vigilance Bureau for allegedly offering a bribe of ₹50 lakh to one of its officers to help him settle cases against him. Reports said that Arora has been facing inquiries in a disproportionate assets case and in connection with alleged irregularities during his tenure as Industries Minister.

139.title: Stopped playing lover boy 10 years ago, found it awkward: Prithviraj
139.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Prithviraj Sukumaran said he stopped playing the role of a lover boy 10 years ago as he "was finding it awkward to do that at 30". Calling 40 a "fantastic age" for him, Prithviraj added, "I no longer have to be scared about playing a role...If being younger on screen doesn't affect me, then being older shouldn't either."

140.title: 4 persons assault woman, 2 minor daughters in Hyderabad; booked
140.article_body: Hyderabad's Humayun Nagar police have booked four people, including three members of an organisation, for allegedly assaulting a woman and her two minor daughters. The woman claimed that the accused "beat with hands, tore...clothes and touched private parts". The incident occurred when the woman went to the organisation's office after one of the accused reportedly approached her minor daughter.

141.title: Traffic movement to be regulated on Delhi roads between Oct 18-21
141.article_body: The traffic movement in Delhi will be regulated from October 18 to 21 in view of the 90th Annual General Assembly of Interpol, which is going to take place in New Delhi's Pragati Maidan next week, an official said. Delegations from 195 countries will attend the event and PM Narendra Modi will be inaugurating the Assembly on October 18.

142.title: Actress Manava says Uber driver threatened her, said 'rukh tereko dikhata hoo'
142.article_body: Actress Manava Naik said that an Uber driver misbehaved with her following an argument over him jumping a signal during her ride in Mumbai. "Driver started threatening me.. 'rukh tereko dikhata hoo'. He then tried to stop the uber in a dark spot...I started yelling. 2 bike riders and 1 rickshaw guy cornered the Uber...and got me out," Naik tweeted.

143.title: Warner will definitely play vs NZ, not sure about warm-up vs India: Finch
143.article_body: Australia T20I captain Aaron Finch has said opener David Warner is unlikely to play against India in their warm-up match on Monday in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "I think Warner will definitely be right for New Zealand," added Finch. Warner suffered whiplash (a neck injury) in the second England T20I after he landed awkwardly while attempting a catch.

144.title: Basavaraj Bommai to visit Delhi to discuss cabinet expansion
144.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai confirmed that he will be going to the national capital to discuss cabinet expansion with BJP National President JP Nadda and other senior leaders. While talking to the media, the CM said that everyone will be informed when the high command gives permission for the cabinet expansion.

145.title: 12 shot dead as gunmen open fire in Mexico bar, 2nd mass shooting in less than 30 days
145.article_body: Unidentified gunmen opened fire in a bar in the central Mexican city of Irapuato on Saturday evening, shooting dead six women and six men, authorities said. Three people were injured in the attack. It is the second mass shooting in Guanajuato in less than a month as 10 people were shot dead at a bar in Tarimoro on September 21.

146.title: Looks like milk is competing with petrol when it comes to price rise: AAP MP
146.article_body: After Amul announced that it is increasing the prices of full cream milk and buffalo milk by ₹2 per litre, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "Looks like milk is competing with petrol when it comes to price rise and breaking the common man's back." Furthermore, he said, "Average Indian families continue to pay for the mistakes of an apathetic government."

147.title: Mumbai to get ₹6,322 crore twin tunnels for East-West connectivity
147.article_body: A 4.7-km-long twin tunnel will be built below Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP), with an extended tunnel passing through the Filmcity in Goregaon as a part of Goregaon Mulund Link Road (GMLR) project. The tunnel will be constructed at the cost of ₹6,322 crore and will connect Western Express Highway with Eastern Express Highway.

148.title: Russia giving Viagra to soldiers, using rape as 'strategy' in Ukraine: UN official
148.article_body: Russia is using rape and sexual assault as a "strategy" in Ukraine, a UN official said in an interview. "When you hear women testify about Russian soldiers equipped with Viagra, it's clearly a military strategy," said UN special representative on sexual violence in conflict, Pramila Patten. UN verified over 100 rape cases in Ukraine since the war began, she added.

149.title: TN police stops suspected human sacrifice, family says ritual was to ward off evil
149.article_body: Tamil Nadu police on Saturday stopped a family of six from performing a suspected human sacrifice at their residence in Tiruvannamalai district. The neighbours reportedly alerted the police after the family did not come out for around three days. The family was performing a ritual to ward off an evil spirit, the police said.

150.title: US, Canada send armoured vehicles to Haiti to fight criminals
150.article_body: US and Canada on Saturday delivered security equipment like tactical and armoured vehicles and supplies to Haiti, according to a joint statement. "This equipment will assist the [Haitian National Police] in their fight against criminal actors who're fomenting violence and disrupting the flow of...humanitarian assistance, hindering efforts to halt the spread of cholera," the joint statement said.

151.title: 14th-ranked Namibia defeat Sri Lanka in first match of T20 World Cup 2022
151.article_body: Namibia, who're the 14th-ranked team, defeated eighth-ranked Sri Lanka by 55 runs in the first match of T20 World Cup 2022 in Geelong. Batting first, Namibia posted a total of 163/7, their highest T20I total against a full-member ICC team. Sri Lanka were bowled out for 108. It's Namibia's first-ever victory against a full-member ICC side in T20 World Cup.

152.title: Akshay shares pic of article claiming he owns '₹260cr private jet'; says 'baseless lies'
152.article_body: Akshay Kumar on Sunday called out a news website for wrongly claiming that the actor owns a private jet worth ₹260 crore. "Liar, Liar...pants on fire...Well, some people have clearly not grown up, and I'm just not in a mood to let them get away with it. Write baseless lies about me, and I'll call it out," Akshay tweeted.

153.title: ICC releases list of all commentators at T20 World Cup 2022, 3 Indians included
153.article_body: The ICC has revealed the commentary team for the T20 World Cup 2022. The official commentary team includes three Indians: Harsha Bhogle, Ravi Shastri and Sunil Gavaskar. Further, Mel Jones, Isa Guha and Natalie Germanos are the female commentators in the group of 29 commentators named for the tournament.

154.title: Manish Sisodia summoned by CBI for questioning in Delhi excise policy case
154.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia has been summoned by CBI for questioning in Delhi excise policy case on October 17. Meanwhile, the Enforcement Directorate raided about 25 locations in national capital as part of its investigation in connection with the policy. Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said excise policy that was disallowed in Delhi is doing wonders in Punjab.

155.title: Sidharth Malhotra, Ananya walk the ramp as showstoppers at Lakme Fashion Week
155.article_body: Sidharth Malhotra and Ananya Panday walked the ramp as showstoppers at the Lakme Fashion Week on Saturday. While Sidharth walked for designer Gaurav Gupta, Ananya Panday wore an embellished blazer dress to represent designer duo Pankaj & Nidhi's 'Solaris' collection. Talking about Gaurav, Sidharth said the designer "balances edgy and masculine aesthetics" with something that looks fashionable.

156.title: Got a call saying 'hope you die': CEO after US firm fires engineers for moonlighting
156.article_body: US-based software company Canopy's CEO Davis Bell said he fired two recently hired engineers for moonlighting. He also revealed that he later got a call from someone telling him they hope Bell dies in a car crash. "[The engineers] were following a new trend of picking up a second, full-time job while lying about it to both employers," Bell said.

157.title: Rupee not sliding, Dollar strengthening incessantly: Nirmala Sitharaman in US
157.article_body: Responding to a question on Rupee's performance in the US, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said she would look at it not as the Rupee sliding but as Dollar strengthening incessantly. She added, "It's a matter of fact India's Rupee probably has withstood this Dollar rate going up. I think Rupee has performed much better than many other emerging market currencies."

158.title: Govt wants to give Kashmir youth bottle of alcohol instead of job: Mufti
158.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti, while criticising the administration, said that the government wants to give the youth a bottle of alcohol instead of a job in Kashmir. Opening of liquor stores won't be allowed in Kashmir, voices will be raised against it, she stated. Earlier, the J&K administration approved the sale of beer at departmental stores in urban centres.

159.title: Factually incorrect: Pak PM on Biden's 'dangerous nation' remark
159.article_body: After US President Joe Biden called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world", the country's PM Shehbaz Sharif said that the remark is "factually incorrect and misleading". He added that Pakistan has proved to be the "most responsible nuclear nation" over the past decades. Earlier, Pakistan had summoned the US ambassador over Biden's comment.

160.title: Duplicity allegation against PM insult to people of Bihar: Nityanand Rai
160.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai criticised JD(U) President Lalan Singh and said that his allegation of duplicity against PM Modi was an insult to 12 crore people of Bihar. He referred to the humble beginnings of PM Modi and said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will have to answer for Lalan Singh's statement.

161.title: US President grabs girl's shoulder, says 'No serious guys until you're 30'; video viral
161.article_body: After addressing a college in US, President Joe Biden gave dating advice to a girl, saying, "Now a very important thing I told my daughters and granddaughters- no serious guys until you're 30." The video of the exchange shows Biden getting a picture clicked with the girl before grabbing her shoulder and advising her.

162.title: 'Mili' has been one of the most challenging roles of my career: Janhvi
162.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor said her upcoming film 'Mili' has been "one of the most challenging roles" of her career. She said the film's director Mathukutty Xavier "brought out the very best" of her on screen. Talking about Janhvi, 'Mili' producer Boney Kapoor said she has performed "phenomenally well" in the film, which is the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film 'Helen'.

163.title: Sri Lanka will be a threat in this T20 World Cup: Gautam Gambhir
163.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir picked Dasun Shanaka-led Sri Lanka to be a threat in the 2022 T20 World Cup. "Because of the kind of success they have had at the Asia Cup. The way they are playing...they're probably peaking at the right time," explained Gambhir. Sri Lanka won the 2022 Asia Cup after defeating Pakistan in the final last month.

164.title: Major fire at Manesar chemical factory, 15 fire tenders rushed to spot
164.article_body: A major fire broke out at a chemical manufacturing factory in Binola, Manesar on Saturday morning. Reports said that no injuries were reported in the incident since the factory was closed. Guards on duty at the factory alerted the police and fire department officials. Reports added that 15 fire tenders were rushed to the spot.

165.title: Trump pressured Truth Social exec to give his shares to Melania: Report
165.article_body: Former President Donald Trump pressured Truth Social Co-founder Andy Litinsky to give shares in the company to his wife, former First Lady Melania Trump, whistleblower Will Wilkerson has alleged. He added that Litinsky refused to do so and told Trump that "the gift would have meant a huge tax bill he couldn't pay". Litinsky was later fired after the incident.

166.title: NOCs not needed for sale of properties in regularised colonies of Gurugram: DTCP
166.article_body: The Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) issued directions that plot owners in regularised colonies of Gurugram are no longer required to obtain no-objection certificates (NOCs) from the department for the sale and purchase of properties. The decision comes after several property owners in the city complained of property registrations getting delayed due to the earlier mandate.

167.title: PM Modi dedicates 75 Digital Banking Units across 75 districts to the nation
167.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday dedicated 75 Digital Banking Units (DBUs) to the nation. The DBUs will be set up in 75 districts and will "further financial inclusion and enhance banking experience for citizens", PM said. They will provide a variety of digital banking facilities, including opening of savings account, funds transfer, investment in fixed deposits, and loan applications.

168.title: Hema Malini is a legend beyond the definitions of superstardom: Shatrughan
168.article_body: Actor-politician Shatrughan Sinha said that in today's day and age of instant success, Hema Malini "is a legend beyond the definitions of superstardom". Wishing the actress-politician on her 74th birthday, Shatrughan added, "Hema and Dharmendra have been my friends for years. It is rare for a friendship to survive so long in this industry where loyalties change every Friday."

169.title: India has the highest unemployment ever in 45 years: Rahul Gandhi
169.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the Centre over unemployment and corruption in the country and said that joblessness is at its peak. "India has the highest unemployment ever in 45 years. The PM had said that he would provide employment to two crore youth every year. Where did those jobs go? Instead, crores of youth have become unemployed," said Rahul.

170.title: Someone other than Rohit should get role of increasing run-rate: Klusener
170.article_body: Ex-South Africa all-rounder Lance Klusener said India should assign the role of increasing run-rate in powerplay to someone other than Rohit Sharma. "There's no need for Rohit to go faster. He was playing easily fast enough, aggressive enough and well enough...not to have changed," Klusener added. India will open their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign against Pakistan on October 23.

171.title: It's all about muscle memory: Uthappa on Shami's lack of match practice
171.article_body: Ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa, on being asked if the lack of match practice will be a problem for pacer Mohammad Shami in the T20 World Cup, said, "Not necessarily." He added, "I think for someone with Shami's experience, it's about muscle memory." Notably, Shami hasn't played a T20I since the T20 World Cup last year.

172.title: Panasonic India announces new line-up of 'truly smart' washing machines
172.article_body: Panasonic India announced a new range of 'Smart Washing Machines' powered by Panasonic’s IoT platform Miraie, starting at ₹19,690. The wi-fi-enabled top-load washing machines are controllable via Miraie, Alexa and/or Google Assistant. They are equipped with Built-In Heater, Wash Wizard for custom recommendations and Stain Genius which gives consumers pre-treatment recommendations based on stains.

173.title: BJP living in denial: Kharge on India's global hunger ranking
173.article_body: After India’s rank on the Global Hunger Index (GHI) dropped to 107th position, Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge said "BJP is living in denial". "BJP…trying to suppress facts has led India to this massive crisis," Kharge added. "Are there any more excuses still left, [PM] Modi Ji?" Kharge asked. Meanwhile, Congress' P Chidambaram criticised the government over the latest GHI report.

174.title: Ghaziabad municipal corporation to ban registration of 3 dog breeds
