174.article_body: The Ghaziabad municipal corporation passed a resolution to not allow registration of three breeds of dogs - Rottweilers, Dogo Argentinos and Pitbulls. The decision was taken by the board in the wake of several dog attack cases involving these three breeds, officials said. Anyone found keeping these dogs without registration will face a penalty of ₹5000, an official added.

175.title: Hardik will finish games like MS Dhoni used to: Raina on T20 World Cup 2022
175.article_body: Former India batter Suresh Raina said his "go-to man" for the T20 World Cup 2022 would be all-rounder Hardik Pandya. "Hardik will finish games like MS Dhoni did for a long period. He will control the game. He'll bowl the crucial overs," added Raina. Further, Raina termed Suryakumar Yadav as a batter whose angle and swing are "brilliant".

176.title: Man stabs transgender person, their partner in Delhi; partner dies
176.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed a transgender person and their partner in Delhi, police said. The transgender person and their partner were taken to hospital where the latter succumbed to his injuries while the former is in serious condition. The incident occurred after the accused apparently started a fight over ₹40,000 borrowed by the transgender person.

177.title: Priyanka reveals she doesn't follow Hasan on Instagram over Malala joke, calls him 'petty'
177.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has shared a screenshot revealing she doesn't follow back Hasan Minhaj on Instagram and called him "petty over funny" backing Malala Yousafzai. Minhaj had joked he doesn't follow back Malala on Instagram after which the Nobel Peace Prize Winner also unfollowed him. Minhaj later shared a reel pretending to be upset and asked Malala to follow him again.

178.title: Trying my hardest to de-escalate it and failing: Musk on Ukraine-Russia situation
178.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said he's trying his "hardest to de-escalate" Ukraine-Russia situation and "obviously failing". His response came to a Twitter user accusing him of continuing support for "US proxy war" in Ukraine after Musk said SpaceX will provide Starlink in Ukraine despite losing money. "Damned if you do, damned if you don't, so...I'm just damned," Musk wrote.

179.title: Did many films with Dharmendra, but 'Sholay' remains special: Hema Malini
179.article_body: Hema Malini said she has done a lot of films with actor-husband Dharmendra, but "'Sholay' remains special". The actress tagged 'Sholay' as her "most famous film". When asked if she'd like to work with Dharmendra again, Hema said she'd like to if they were offered "something like what Meryl Streep and Clint Eastwood did in 'The Bridges Of Madison County'".

180.title: Terrorists will be turned to dust: J&K BJP chief on killing of Kashmiri Pandit
180.article_body: Reacting to the killing of Puran Krishan Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit, in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district, J&K's BJP chief Ravinder Raina said those who conspired to target Puran will have to bear the brunt. "The Army-Police have put up check nakas, and the conspiring terrorists will be turned to dust," he added. Puran was shot dead near his residence.

181.title: Duo cheats people of ₹6 cr on pretext of investment in Hyd; held
181.article_body: Two persons were arrested on Saturday for allegedly cheating over 25 people to the tune of ₹6 crore on the pretext of investment in film distribution in Hyderabad. According to a police officer, the accused had cheated the people by promising them good profits but they reportedly didn't return the principal amount nor did they pay the profits collected.

182.title: India's 19-year-old Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi defeats world number one Magnus Carlsen
182.article_body: India's 19-year-old Grandmaster Arjun Erigaisi defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in the seventh round of Airchess Rapid. This is the first time that Erigaisi defeated Carlsen in his chess career. Arjun is currently placed fifth on the tournament's points table with 15 points, having won a total of four matches so far.

183.title: Chhattisgarh Assembly Deputy Speaker Manoj Singh dies of heart attack at 58
183.article_body: Chhattisgarh Assembly Deputy Speaker Manoj Singh Mandavi passed away after suffering a heart attack at age of 58 on Sunday. Reports said that Mandavi was taken to hospital in Dhamtari town. Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel condoled his demise and called it an "irreparable loss". Mandavi's last rites will be performed in Nathiya Nawagaon in Kanker, news agency ANI reported.

184.title: India reports 2,401 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,625
184.article_body: India reported 2,401 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 2,373 people recovered in the last 24 hours, following which active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 26,625. The recovery rate in the country currently stands at 98.76%, while the daily positivity rate is at 1.04%.

185.title: Mamata Banerjee befooling people of West Bengal: Suvendu Adhikari
185.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari wrote a letter to Union Minister Piyush Goyal and claimed that West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is befooling people by renaming Centre's already launched schemes. "The Khadya Sathi scheme is another infamous sticker scheme of the Mamata Banerjee government...It is nothing but a label placed on the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana," wrote Adhikari.

186.title: Incorporate feminist thinking in way you deal with law: SC judge to students
186.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud on Saturday advised young law students to incorporate feminist thinking in the way they dealt with law. While addressing the convocation of the National Law University (NLU), Delhi, Justice Chandrachud said, "You must strive to make the legal system more inclusive and accessible when you become a part of it.

187.title: US Prez Biden calls UK PM Truss' tax cut plan a 'mistake'
187.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that it's "predictable" that UK PM Liz Truss had to drop a tax-cutting plan, adding, "I wasn't...only one that thought it was a mistake."  "I disagreed with...policy, but that's up to Great Britain to make that judgment," he further said. Earlier, UK's new Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt also called the tax cuts "mistakes".

188.title: Google manager held hostage, forcibly married to a girl by her family in MP
188.article_body: A man working as a senior manager at Google in Bengaluru has alleged he was taken hostage in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal and forcibly married to a girl whom he had met while pursuing MBA. He told the police he was forcibly given intoxicants to marry her, following which her family members clicked some photographs and demanded ₹40 lakh from him.

189.title: Cong youngsters with me, seniors backing Kharge: Tharoor on Cong chief poll
189.article_body: Congress Presidential poll candidate Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said youngsters and people in lower levels of the party are supporting him, while seniors are backing Mallikarjun Kharge. "We've been talking about change and older people resist it," Tharoor added. It would be foolish on the part of any Congress President to distance himself from the Gandhis, he stated.

190.title: 65-yr-old man beaten up by drunk men on grandson's bday dies in Punjab
190.article_body: A 65-year-old man, who was reportedly beaten up by drunk men who barged into his house during the birthday celebrations of his grandson, died days after incident. The incident took place on October 4. Police have arrested four men in connection with the case. Those arrested were part of a group of 15 men who had barged into victim's house.

191.title: Peon demands sexual favour from pregnant woman in Mumbai, her husband stabs him
191.article_body: Husband of an eight-month pregnant Asha worker was arrested by Mumbai Police after he attacked a man who allegedly tried to demand sexual favours from his wife. The victim, a bank peon by profession, approached the woman for her number. Assuming that he had some health department related work, she shared her number and later received calls demanding sexual favour.

192.title: 'Uunchai' is probably the most fulfilling experience of my career: Boman
192.article_body: Actor Boman Irani said his upcoming film 'Uunchai' is "probably the most fulfilling experience" of his acting career. "This is a very emotional film for me and this experience is beyond my words. I will cherish this for as long as I live," he said. Boman added that people who believe in goodness and relationships will love the film.

193.title: Bus overturns on highway in Colombia leaving 20 dead, 15 injured
193.article_body: At least 20 people were killed and 15 others were injured after a bus overturned on a highway in southwestern Colombia, police said. It reportedly took nine hours to set bus upright, evacuate the injured and recover the deceased's bodies. As per a preliminary report, the bus driver lost control after coming out of a curve in a foggy area.

194.title: 4 women from same family fall into river while taking selfie in Maha; 2 die
194.article_body: Two sisters died while two others from the same family were rescued after they slipped and fell into Vaitarna river while a taking selfie in Maharashtra's Virar on Saturday. The deceased were identified as 15-year-old Santu Dasan and her 24-year-old sister Neela. Locals along with railway workers rescued the other two women using ropes.

195.title: Figment of imagination: Capitalmind CEO on viral post on UPI 'killing' toffee business
195.article_body: A LinkedIn post claiming that UPI is "killing" the candy business has gone viral. Drawing a link between candy makers losing revenue and the rise of UPI, GrowthX Founder Abhishek Patil said shopkeepers would "trade toffees for loose cash" earlier, but this stopped with UPI. Capitalmind CEO Deepak Shenoy refuted Patil's claim, saying it "seems like a figment of imagination".

196.title: Fire breaks out at Iran's infamous prison amid anti-hijab protests, shots heard
196.article_body: A fire broke out in Tehran's Evin prison, where many of Iran's political and dual-national detainees are held, on Saturday night and witnesses reported hearing gunfire. State news agency IRNA said eight people were injured in the unrest, which erupted after nearly a month of protests across Iran over the death in detention of Mahsa Amini, a 22-year-old woman.

197.title: Layoffs are withdrawal symptoms of founders on steroids: Ronnie Screwvala
197.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad's Co-founder Ronnie Screwvala told ET NOW in an interview, "Layoffs are unfortunately withdrawal symptoms of founders being on steroids." He said that a company's expansion beyond its scope can also lead to layoffs. Screwvala's comments come soon after BYJU'S said it will lay off 5% of its 50,000 workforce over the next six months.

198.title: Huge crowds at bus, railway stations in UP as candidates return from UP PET exam
198.article_body: Huge crowd of passengers were found thronging several bus depots and railway stations of Uttar Pradesh on Saturday evening as candidates, who appeared for UPSSSC Preliminary Eligibility Test (PET) 2022, returned from their exam centres. Huge rush was reported from Kanpur Central, Ghazipur and Sitapur railway stations. The prelims of the two-tier examination will conclude today.

199.title: Mumbai firm's CEO cheated of ₹9.78 lakh after being promised elite club card
199.article_body: A 73-year-old Chief Executive Officer of a private firm in Mumbai was cheated of ₹9.78 lakh after he was promised a Diners Club International credit card by fraudster, reports said. The victim was sent a link to fill in all his information. The fraudster even sent his accomplice with an android phone for the CEO to download a mobile application.

200.title: Tejashwi Yadav will become Bihar CM in few months: RJD MLA
200.article_body: RJD MLA Izhar Asfi on Saturday claimed that Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav will soon become the new CM of Bihar. "The people of Bihar want it and I think most of the leaders of the state are ready for it...maybe it will take a month or two but Tejashwi Yadav will indeed become the CM of Bihar," Asfi stated.

201.title: Pune Police arrest 8 in connection with alleged murder attempt
201.article_body: Pune Police arrested eight people for allegedly attempting to kill the complainant, Rohit Khate, from the Dattawadi area due to old enmity. Khate informed the police that around 10 people barged into his apartment on Thursday night with weapons. The police laid a trap and nabbed the accused, including two minors. According to police, most of the accused are history-sheeters.

202.title: Falling in Champions League is sad, but El Clasico is great opportunity: Xavi
202.article_body: With Barcelona facing elimination in the ongoing Champions League, their manager Xavi has said El Clasico against Real Madrid on Sunday is a great opportunity for them to recover and regain confidence. "We're the (La Liga) leaders and we want to continue to be as of Sunday," he added. Barcelona have won seven of their eight games in La Liga.

203.title: Salman Khan's 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' to release on Eid 2023
203.article_body: Salman Khan announced that his film 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' will now release on Eid 2023. The news came after he shared that 'Tiger 3' has been postponed and will now release on Diwali 2023. 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan', which will also feature Pooja Hegde and Shehnaaz Gill, was earlier expected to release in December 2022.

204.title: Mother Dairy hikes prices of full cream, cow milk by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR from today
204.article_body: Mother Dairy has hiked prices of full cream milk and cow milk by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR with effect from today. This is the third time that the prices of Mother Dairy milk have been hiked in Delhi-NCR this year. Mother Dairy had earlier increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR in March and mid-August.

205.title: Bengaluru-Mysuru highway flooded due to heavy rain
205.article_body: Parts of the Bengaluru–Mysuru highway were flooded after a lake near Mandya overflowed due to heavy rainfall in the city on Friday night. The Bengaluru Traffic Police asked the commuters to use an alternative route. "People who are travelling to Mysuru are advised to use Bengaluru – Nagamangala – Pandavapura – Srirangapattana – Mysuru road," the traffic police said.

206.title: 16-year-old boy falls from multi-level parking, dies in Noida
206.article_body: A 16-year-old boy died after he allegedly fell off the fencing of a multi-level parking in Noida's Sector-18, police said on Saturday. Preliminary investigations revealed that the boy was trying to make a video while attempting to get on top of the fencing, according to police. "The boy was found with a...phone in his hand," DCP (Noida) Harish Chander said.

207.title: 9 people killed after tempo collides with milk vehicle in Karnataka
207.article_body: Nine people were killed after a tempo traveller collided with a KMF milk vehicle in Karnataka's Hassan. Police said that the victims were returning home after visiting Dharmasthala, Subramanya and Hasanamba temples. The deceased include a two-year-old child and three children aged 10, 10 and 12. The deceased also include 50-year-old Leelavati, 33-year-old Chaitra and 20-year-old Vandana.

208.title: In 1 or 2 games, you could see Pant playing again: Suresh Raina
208.article_body: Former India batter Suresh Raina has said wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is an "X-factor" and will be getting a few games in the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "Pant has done it (made runs previously) in Australia...[and] if you see from 1-6, there's no leftie batter...So, in one or two games, you could see him playing again," explained Raina.

209.title: Egyptian national smuggling ₹41.86 lakh-gold held at Hyd airport
209.article_body: An Egyptian national who was allegedly smuggling gold worth ₹41.86 lakh in the form of a chain and bangles was arrested at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport on Saturday. The gold, weighing 802 gm, was seized after it was found during personal and baggage search of the passengers, Hyderabad Customs tweeted. The accused had arrived in Hyderabad from Kuwait.

210.title: Great Brutal Britain: Mahindra as UK newspaper asks 'Can Liz Truss outlast lettuce?'
210.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra reacted to reports of a British newspaper challenging UK Prime Minister Liz Truss to outlast a head of iceberg lettuce. The tabloid started a livestream on YouTube with an unrefrigerated lettuce next to a photo of Truss and asked, "Can Liz Truss outlast a lettuce?" Responding to a tweet about the livestream, Mahindra wrote, "Great (Brutal) Britain."

211.title: I'll do films which are progressive & have a moral: Ayushmann
211.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana said he wants to do films that "are progressive" and "have a moral". Calling such films his "USP", the actor said he doesn't want to do films that are regressive in nature. "I know, the popular palate is slightly regressive, but I can't change my mindset like that," Ayushmann said, adding that he believes in cinema for change.

212.title: Mumbai local train services to be hit today due to mega block
212.article_body: Mumbai local train services will remain hit on Sunday as Central Railway (Mumbai division) will carry out a mega block on its suburban sections for various engineering and maintenance works. Due to the mega block, local trains leaving and arriving at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) from 11.00 am to 5.00 pm will reach their destination 15 minutes behind schedule.

213.title: Full control over Hong Kong achieved, determined on Taiwan: Xi Jinping
213.article_body: China has achieved comprehensive control over Hong Kong, turning it from chaos to governance, Chinese President Xi Jinping said in a speech on Sunday at the opening of the once-in-five-year Communist Party congress in Beijing. China has also waged a major struggle against Taiwan separatism and is determined and able to oppose territorial integrity, Xi said.

214.title: Resident & security guard slap, punch each other in Ghaziabad; incident caught on CCTV
214.article_body: A CCTV footage showing a resident and a security guard of a housing society slapping and punching each other in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad has surfaced online. The guard had reportedly stopped the man and asked him where he was going, following which the man slapped the guard. Police said a case has been registered in connection with the case.

215.title: 2 gunmen open fire during target practice at Russian military ground, kill 11 soldiers
215.article_body: At least 11 Russian soldiers have been killed and over 15 wounded after two gunmen opened fire on a group of volunteers during a target practice session at a military ground in the western part of the country. The Russian Defence Ministry said the two gunmen had been shot dead after the attack. The ministry called it a terrorist attack.

216.title: Up to 85% off across brands + 250 NeuCoins on your 1st order: Tata Neu
216.article_body: Shop at The Grand Sale by Tata Neu with great deals on fashion, electronics, groceries, food orders, hotel stays, personal loans, medicines, flights and in-flight meals, said the brand. Get 10% instant discount/cashback with ICICI Bank credit cards from 19th to 21st October and 5% NeuCoins on every purchase only on Tata Neu, they added.

217.title: The hell with it, we'll keep funding Ukraine govt despite Starlink losing money: Musk
217.article_body: A day after saying SpaceX cannot indefinitely fund its Starlink service in Ukraine, billionaire Elon Musk on Saturday said it will continue to do the same. "The hell with it...even though Starlink is still losing money and other companies are getting billions of taxpayer dollars, we'll just keep funding Ukraine govt for free," tweeted Musk.

218.title: French delegation to check workers' conditions in Qatar ahead of WC
218.article_body: The French Football Federation (FFF) said it will send a delegation to Qatar to conduct checks on the working conditions of migrant workers ahead of the 2022 FIFA World Cup. The move comes after a documentary revealed poor living conditions at the team's World Cup base in Doha. FFF President Noel Le Graet earlier played down the documentary's revelations.

219.title: Nikola Founder Trevor Milton found guilty of fraud over misleading statements
219.article_body: Trevor Milton, Founder and former CEO of electric truck maker Nikola, was found guilty of three of four counts of fraud relating to false statements about Nikola's stock in a US federal court. Milton was accused of "repeatedly disseminating false and misleading information...through social media". He could face up to 25 years in prison if convicted on all four counts.

220.title: Goalkeeper Sa playing with a broken wrist since Aug: Wolves manager
220.article_body: Wolverhampton Wanderers manager Steve Davis said club goalkeeper Jose Sa has been playing with a broken wrist since August. "For him to do that and get on with it shows the courage he has got. It shows his character," said Davis. Sa sustained the injury during Wolves' second game of the season against Fulham in which he saved a penalty.

221.title: Outgoing BCCI President Ganguly to contest for CAB President post
221.article_body: After being denied the opportunity to be the BCCI President for a second term, former India captain Sourav Ganguly will contest for the post of Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) President. The CAB polls are scheduled to be held on October 31. Ganguly was reportedly offered the post of IPL Chairman, which he declined.

222.title: DMK warns of protest in Delhi if Hindi is imposed in Tamil Nadu
222.article_body: DMK MLA and Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin's son, Udhayanidhi Stalin, has warned that the party would stage a protest against the BJP-led Centre in Delhi if Hindi is imposed in Tamil Nadu. DMK protested in Tamil Nadu over the matter on Saturday. The opposition to Hindi imposition wouldn't end with a day's protest and by raising slogans, Udhayanidhi said.

223.title: S Jaishankar discusses Ukraine war with Egyptian Foreign Minister
223.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar discussed the Ukraine war, developments in the Indo-Pacific and other regional topics with his Egyptian counterpart Sameh Shoukry in Cairo on Saturday. Jaishankar is on a two-day visit to Egypt at the invitation of Shoukry. "A warm and productive meeting with FM Sameh Shoukry...as we mark 75 years of diplomatic relations this year," Jaishankar tweeted.

224.title: Drunk cousin rapes, kills 16-year-old girl in Rajasthan; arrested
224.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was allegedly raped and killed by her drunk cousin in Rajasthan's Meghasar village. The accused, a farm worker from Punjab's Kabarwala, has been arrested in connection with the crime. As per reports, he strangled the girl when she resisted his attempts. The minor's body was found buried in the sand near railway tracks in Rajasthan.

225.title: Woman, her 2 children attacked by their pet pitbull in Haryana
225.article_body: A woman and her two children were attacked and injured by their pet pitbull dog in Baliar Khurd village of Haryana's Rewari district on Friday, PTI reported. The woman received 50 stitches on her leg, hand and head, according to her family. The two children were reportedly discharged from the hospital on Saturday.

226.title: Lankan govt to use Indian credit line to install solar panels
226.article_body: Sri Lanka's Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera on Saturday said a credit line of $100 million extended by India will be used to install rooftop solar panels in government buildings, educational institutions and hospitals. The decision comes amidst widespread protests over high power tariffs in the country. Sri Lanka raised its electricity tariff by an average of 75% this August.

227.title: Delhi logs 135 COVID-19 cases, no deaths in last 24 hours
227.article_body: Delhi recorded 135 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 2.12% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Saturday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the national capital. The city's active case count stood at 465, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Delhi's total case tally has climbed to 20,04,787.

228.title: Who is the highest run-getter and highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup history?
228.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena is the highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup history. He scored 1,016 runs in 31 T20 World Cup innings. He's followed by Chris Gayle (965 runs) and Tillakaratne Dilshan (897 runs). Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan is the highest wicket-taker in the tournament history with 41 scalps. He is followed by Shahid Afridi (39 wickets).

229.title: Pak summons US envoy as Prez Biden calls it 'one of world's most dangerous nations'
229.article_body: Pakistan has summoned the US ambassador after President Joe Biden called it "one of the most dangerous nations in the world", Pakistani Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari said. He further said he was surprised by Biden's remarks, adding, "Pakistan's nuclear assets...meet all- each and every- international standard in accordance with the IAEA."

230.title: More downforce at lower drag to be competitive in 2023: Mercedes F1
230.article_body: Mercedes F1 have said their 2023 car needs to have "more downforce at the lower drag level" to be competitive. The team had likened the current car to an "onion" that revealed new issues every time they improved something. After solving the 'porpoising' issue, Mercedes reportedly found that their car was 8-10 kph slower than Red Bull on the straights.

231.title: Odisha govt to abolish contractual hirings, 57,000 employees to benefit
231.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Saturday said the system of contractual hirings will be abolished and that the services of over 57,000 contract employees will be regularised. He said this decision will cost the government ₹1,300 crore annually. "This decision brings early Diwali for their (contract employees) family members," he said.

232.title: Russian strike damages energy facility in Ukraine's capital region
232.article_body: A key energy facility in Ukraine's capital region suffered serious damages in a Russian missile strike, the country's grid operator said on Saturday. No one was injured or killed as a result of the strike on the unidentified facility, the Kyiv region's governor said. Electricity transmission company Ukrenergo said efforts to restore the power supply were underway.

233.title: Satellite pic shows nuclear bombers deployed by Russia near NATO border
233.article_body: Satellite images from an independent Norwegian fact-checking website have shown that Russia has deployed 11 nuclear-capable long-range bombers at an airbase close to neighbouring Norway, which is a NATO member. Seven Tu-160s and four Tu-95 planes have reportedly been parked at the Olenya Air Base, as per pictures released by Faktisk.no. The number of Tu-160s parked there has steadily increased.

234.title: There's a real calmness, confidence in our team: Aaron Finch
234.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that there is calmness among the team members ahead of the T20 World Cup. "It would have been nice to win against England but it's not the be-all and end-all...There's a real...confidence that we know our best is good enough on the day," Finch said. Notably, Australia lost the T20I series to England by 2-0.

235.title: Eradicating corruption is Haryana govt's utmost priority: CM Khattar
235.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday said eradicating corruption is his government's utmost priority. "Concrete steps have been taken in this direction," Khattar said. Speaking at a function in Haryana's Nayagaon, Khattar said he has made power a means to serve people and dedicated efforts are being made to raise the living standard of the poor through government schemes.

236.title: UP policemen who killed my wife were drunk: BJP leader Gurtaj Singh
236.article_body: BJP leader Gurtaj Singh has alleged that Uttar Pradesh Police officials who barged into his home and shot his wife dead in Uttarakhand on Friday were drunk. Gurpreet Kaur was killed while officials were chasing a criminal. Singh said, "[Police] are spreading propaganda that they were kept hostage." He added, "I'm...a public representative of the government, yet...this happened to me."

237.title: PCB appoints dedicated physio for Shaheen, Fakhar for T20 WC: Reports
237.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has reportedly appointed a dedicated physiotherapist for bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi and batter Fakhar Zaman during the T20 World Cup in Australia. Due to the kind of injuries suffered by the duo, PCB reportedly asked London-based physiotherapist, Dr Javed Akhtar Mughal, to join the squad. Dr Mughal worked with the players during their recent rehabilitation.

238.title: ED attaches properties worth ₹1,317 crore of Ireo Group
238.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached properties worth around ₹1,317 crore linked to the Ireo Group. The senior management of the group is alleged to have siphoned off ₹1,225 crore of funds belonging to homebuyers. The attached properties include residential premises, commercial spaces, bank accounts belonging to the company and its chairman Lalit Goyal.

239.title: 'Mirzapur' fame actor Jitendra Shastri passes away
239.article_body: Actor Jitendra Shastri, who was known for playing the role of Usmaan in the Ali Fazal and Pankaj Tripathi-led web series 'Mirzapur', has passed away. Actor Sanjay Mishra took to social media to share the news. Actor Rajesh Tailang, while mourning his demise, tweeted "Can't believe Jitu Bhai is no more, what an amazing actor, what a wonderful human being."

240.title: They've shown outstanding skill, teamwork: PM on India's Women's Asia Cup win
240.article_body: PM Narendra Modi congratulated India following their record-extending seventh Women's Asia Cup title on Saturday. "Our women's cricket team makes us proud with their grit and dexterity!...They have shown outstanding skill and teamwork," tweeted PM Modi. BCCI Secretary Jay Shah took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations to Harmanpreet Kaur and her team for raising the bar in women's cricket."

241.title: 21-yr-old Man Utd footballer Greenwood charged with attempted rape, controlling behaviour
241.article_body: Manchester United's 21-year-old footballer Mason Greenwood has been charged with attempted rape, engaging in controlling behaviour and assault. He was initially arrested in January after social media images and videos were posted by a woman reporting incidents of physical violence. He has been suspended by United pending investigation. The alleged rape is said to have occurred on October 22, 2021.

242.title: Was obsessed with Sridevi, I used to imitate her: Shefali Shah
242.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said in an interview that earlier she was obsessed with late actress Sridevi. "I was also told that I looked like her and then slowly I started imitating her," she added. "Thankfully, wisdom came knocking one day and I was like what am I doing? There can't be another Sridevi, so stop it," Shefali further said.

243.title: Bhuvneshwar is still the go-to guy for Rohit Sharma: Suresh Raina
243.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Suresh Raina said that seamer Bhuvneshwar Kumar is still the go-to guy for skipper Rohit Sharma. "Bhuvneshwar is an experienced bowler...Sometimes you go for runs, but he still has that swing," Raina said. He added, "When Virat [Kohli] scored a hundred, [Bhuvneshwar] also took five wickets against Afghanistan...He has that knuckleball, swing and he hits areas well."

244.title: 18-yr-old NEET aspirant dies of liver disease in Raj, 35 other students ill
244.article_body: An 18-year-old NEET aspirant, who was diagnosed with severe liver disease, died during treatment at a private hospital in Rajasthan's Kota, an official said on Saturday. The victim was among 36 students, who were suffering from the disease. Kota CMHO said three water suppliers in the area were found to be supplying contaminated drinking water to coaching institutes and canteens.

245.title: Just stuck to basics and got rewards: Renuka on 3/5 in Asia Cup final
245.article_body: India pacer Renuka Singh said she's happy to be named 'Player of the Match' in India's eight-wicket win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup 2022 final. Renuka posted bowling figures of 3-1-5-3. "In...last few games, I didn't bowl well. I practised with my coach...staff and got better. I didn't try anything, just stuck to...basics and got rewards," she added.

246.title: Waited for 12-14 hrs for Kareena during my debut film's shoot: Tusshar
246.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor, speaking on the insider versus outsider debate, said that a "red carpet" is not laid out for every star kid. "While shooting for my debut film, 'Mujhe Kucch Kehna Hai', I'd to wait for...co-star and another star kid Kareena Kapoor...for 12-14 hours as she was simultaneously working on four films," he said, adding he considers himself an outsider.

247.title: Immediately starting work on gas hub proposed by Russia: Turkey
247.article_body: Turkish and Russian officials have been told to immediately start technical work on a proposed natural gas hub in Turkey, President Recep Erdogan has said. Russian President Vladimir Putin had earlier proposed that this hub could sell gas "to third countries, especially in Europe". The proposal aims to export more gas through the TurkStream gas pipeline.

248.title: Video shows UP policeman stealing bulb from shop; suspended
248.article_body: Sub-inspector Rajesh Verma from Uttar Pradesh Police was suspended after a video of him stealing a bulb from outside a shop went viral. The video shows Verma discreetly looking around before removing the bulb. He then puts it in his pocket and walks away. Defending himself, Verma said he removed the bulb as it was dark where he was stationed.

249.title: 5 drug peddlers booked under PSA in J&K's Budgam district
249.article_body: Five alleged drug peddlers were booked under the Public Safety Act (PSA) in J&K's Budgam district, police said on Saturday. The PSA was invoked against the accused after obtaining sanctions from the competent authority, as per the police. The accused were involved in 12 cases registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act across central Kashmir, police added.

250.title: Kashmir Freedom Fighters claims responsibility for killing Kashmiri Pandit in J&K
250.article_body: Hours after Puran Krishan Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit, died after being shot in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Saturday, terror outfit Kashmir Freedom Fighters has claimed responsibility for the killing, police said. Bhat was on his way to an orchard in Chowdari Gund when he was fired upon. Police said they are ascertaining the reason behind the killing.

251.title: Mistakes were made: New UK Finance Minister on recent tax cuts
251.article_body: UK's new Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt on Saturday said his predecessor had made some "mistakes", referring to the tax cuts announced last month. "We will have some very difficult decisions ahead," Hunt said. His predecessor Kwasi Kwarteng was sacked by Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday, after less than six weeks on the job.

252.title: Illegal property of 2 drug peddlers demolished in Haryana's Fatehabad
252.article_body: The district authorities on Saturday demolished an illegally built house of two drug peddler brothers in Haryana's Fatehabad. "Both the brothers were booked in 14 cases under...NDPS Act," Jakhal Police Station SHO Jai Bhagwan said. "One week ago, the municipal committee officials had served notice to the family of these peddlers asking them to vacate the house," SHO added.

253.title: Which are the best & worst-performing countries as per latest global hunger rankings?
253.article_body: Seventeen countries have shared the top rank in the Global Hunger Index 2022, including China, Belarus, Turkey, Chile, Croatia, Estonia, Hungary and Kuwait. These countries got a score of less than five on the index. Among the worst-performing nations is Yemen (ranked last at 121st position) followed by the Central African Republic, Madagascar, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Chad etc.

254.title: 2 killed in road accident in Jharkhand's Dumka district
254.article_body: Two people were killed following a collision between a motorcycle and a truck carrying stone chips in Jharkhand's Dumka district on Saturday, police said. Another person was critically injured in the accident that took place on a stretch of the Dumka-Rampurhat national highway near Simluti village, police added. The deceased include a man and a woman, as per a doctor.

255.title: Woman sedated at house party, gang-raped by guests in Pune
255.article_body: A woman, who had arranged a house party at her residence in Pune on October 9, was reportedly gang-raped by her guests. The woman claimed that after the party, she went to her room to rest, following which the accused entered the room, sprayed sedatives on her and raped her. Police have arrested two persons in the case.

256.title: Wasim Jaffer shares 'Kota Factory' meme to react to Rohit, Babar hugging each other
256.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to react to pictures of Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Pakistan captain Babar Azam hugging each other during a photoshoot ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. Reacting to the picture, he shared a meme from the first season of 'Kota Factory', which read, "Kitna parivarik mahol hai (What a familial atmosphere)."

257.title: I am going to 'mankad' someone next year: Rajasthan Royals' Riyan Parag
257.article_body: Rajasthan Royals all-rounder Riyan Parag took to Twitter and stated that he's going to "mankad" someone next year, adding, "It is going to create a fun Twitter debate." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "What if you don't get a chance to be in playing XI?" Parag responded, "Some positivity please...sir." "Ashwin will definitely support you," a fan wrote.

258.title: Wasn't able to perform my duties: Boora Narsaiah Goud after quitting TRS
258.article_body: Former TRS MP Boora Narsaiah Goud, after resigning from the party, alleged that he was not able to perform his duties and was not consulted on the decision to start Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS). "I didn't criticise the CM in my resignation letter," Goud said. "I've been through a lot of pain while separating from this family (TRS)," he added.

259.title: Really poor from you: Badani on Starc taking Deepti's name while giving 'mankad' warning
259.article_body: Reacting to a video of Australia pacer Mitchell Starc giving 'mankad' warning to England's Jos Buttler by saying, "I'm not Deepti, but I won't do it",  ex-India cricketer Hemang Badani tweeted, "Grow up Starc...That's really poor from you." He added, "If you only want to warn...non-striker...that's fine...but you bringing Deepti into this isn't what the cricket world expects of you."

260.title: Indian Army signs MoUs with 11 banks for Agniveer Salary Package
260.article_body: The Indian Army has signed Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) with 11 banks for providing banking facilities to Agniveers under the Agniveer Salary Package. The MoUs were signed with banks including State Bank of India, Punjab National Bank, Bank of Baroda and ICICI Bank. The first batch of Agniveers on enrolment under the 'Agnipath Scheme' will join training centres by January.

261.title: 22-year-old student's body found in drain near Noida college
261.article_body: The body of a 22-year-old student was found in a drain near Galgotias University in Greater Noida on Saturday. The student had been missing since October 12. His family alleged that five students killed him after a fight. There are no apparent injuries on the body of the deceased, said the police. The body has been sent for post-mortem.

262.title: No action by PM on K'taka govt corruption allegation: Siddaramaiah
262.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah said PM Narendra Modi took no action on the letter sent to him by a contractors association accusing the state government of charging 40% commission on public work. "Where are you, Mr Narendra Modi?... Aren't you ashamed?" asked Siddaramaiah. He added that the BJP's only contribution in Karnataka's Ballari was looting natural resources by the mining barons.

263.title: Bodies of 2 children recovered from well in Gujarat; mother missing
263.article_body: The bodies of two minor siblings, whose mother is missing, were recovered from a well in Gujarat's Jamnagar. Police have launched a search operation to trace the missing woman. A case of accidental death was registered after the children's bodies were found. Police suspect the woman may have thrown her five-year-old and three-month-old children in the well.

264.title: 4 including ex-BSP leader's 3 sons booked in gang-rape case in UP
264.article_body: Four people, including three sons of former BSP MLC and mining mafia Haji Iqbal, have been booked in connection with a gang-rape case in Uttar Pradesh, a senior police officer said on Saturday. Iqbal is absconding while his sons are already in jail in different cases, the officer added. The fourth accused was arrested on Saturday.

265.title: Nothing to criticise about Khushi's work in 'The Archies': Boney Kapoor
265.article_body: After watching the teaser of daughter Khushi Kapoor's debut film 'The Archies', producer Boney Kapoor said, "There was nothing to criticise as it was amazing." "We discussed the good points as those were the only things I could see. The same happens when I see Janhvi's films," he added. He also said that Khushi usually doesn't discuss work with him.

266.title: Nadal doesn't look great playing, Federer is smooth, very elegant: Tyson
266.article_body: Boxing legend Mike Tyson has said he's a big fan of Roger Federer, adding when the 20-time Grand Slam champion was in his prime, he was always moving in the air. "Rafael Nadal was just all over the place. He's a great player, but he doesn't look great playing. Federer is smooth and very elegant," he further said.

267.title: Prescribe medicines in Hindi, write Shri Hari on top: MP CM Chouhan
267.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan asked why prescriptions cannot be written in Hindi and said doctors should "write Shri Hari on the top and the names of medicines below". He said the government was not against English but awareness about the official language is necessary. He said Indians had become "slaves" to the English language.

268.title: Kerala govt opposes ED plea seeking transfer of gold smuggling case
268.article_body: Kerala government has filed an affidavit in the SC opposing the ED's plea seeking the transfer of trial in the Kerala gold smuggling case to Karnataka. After completion of the investigation and evidence collection, and submission of a supplementary complaint, ED cannot seek transfer of the case merely on the ground of alleged interference by state police, the government argued.

269.title: Arjun Rampal, girlfriend Gabriella to star in 'Project Love': Reports
269.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal has signed on to star in an upcoming comic caper, titled 'Project Love', according to reports. It will reportedly also feature the actor's girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades. As per reports, the story revolves around a brother who decides to make a plan to kidnap his sister in order to save her from her boyfriend who is an opportunist.

270.title: No unparliamentary language used to question PM's caste: JD(U) chief
270.article_body: JD(U) President Lalan Singh defended his remarks on PM Modi's caste and said he did not use any "unparliamentary language". "What will you call someone who...tries to mislead people by furnishing wrong facts?" asked Singh. He had said that PM Modi claimed to be from the extremely backward class in 2014 even though "Gujarat has no EBC category".

271.title: Patient plays saxophone while undergoing brain surgery in Italy, video surfaces
271.article_body: A musician in Italy who underwent a "very, very complex" brain surgery to remove a tumour, played his saxophone during the nine-hour procedure. The 35-year-old man underwent the 'awake surgery', allowing doctors to check his speech and motor skills to ensure they haven't been damaged. A video showed him playing 'Love Story' movie theme song and the Italian national anthem.

272.title: Jaya says grandson Agastya watches 'Kabhi Khushi...' to make fun of her
272.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of her granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast 'What The Hell Navya', revealed that her grandson Agastya Nanda watches 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' to "make fun" of her in it. The Karan Johar directorial was released in 2001. Agastya is all set to make his acting debut with Zoya Akhtar's upcoming 'The Archies'.

273.title: Murder probe launched after girl's body found in a trunk in Paris
273.article_body: A murder investigation was launched on Saturday following the recovery of a 12-year-old girl's body from a trunk outside her family's building in Paris. According to French media, surveillance footage shows the girl entering the building's lobby at 3 pm (local time) on Friday. Cameras also reportedly show a woman dragging a trunk with some difficulty later in the day.

274.title: My grandfather always told me tennis was boxing at 90 ft: Jimmy Connors
274.article_body: Jimmy Connors revealed that his grandfather trained him as a boxer as part of his tennis training. "My grandfather was a boxer...He always told me...tennis was boxing at 90 feet. Because you had to learn how to take...blows and come back from it," he added. With 109 titles, Connors holds the record for most men's singles titles in Open Era.

275.title: ED raids coaching centre of TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya's aide
275.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday raided a coaching centre owned by Tapas Mondal, a close aide of TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya, in West Bengal. The raid was conducted in connection with the alleged state SSC recruitment scam case. Bhattacharya was arrested on Tuesday for alleged irregularities in teachers' appointments. He's the ex-President of West Bengal Board of Primary Education.

276.title: Why does India's T20 World Cup 2022 jersey have just one star on it?
276.article_body: India's T20 World Cup 2022 jersey has only one star on it instead of the usual three stars on India's limited-over jersey. The three stars represent India's World Cup wins: 1983 ODI World Cup, 2007 T20 World Cup and 2011 ODI World Cup. The solitary star for the T20 World Cup 2022 represents just India's 2007 T20 World Cup win.

277.title: ICC releases list of 10 records that could be smashed at T20 World Cup 2022
277.article_body: The ICC has released a list of 10 records that could be smashed at T20 World Cup 2022, which begins in Australia tomorrow. The records include Mahela Jayawardena's record for scoring most runs in T20 WC history (1,016), Chris Gayle's record for slamming most T20 WC centuries (two), Virat Kohli's record for registering most scores of 50+ in T20 WC.

278.title: When have we shown aggression?: Imran Khan as US Prez calls Pakistan 'dangerous'
278.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan raised questions over the remarks of US President Joe Biden after the latter called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world". "On what info has [US President] reached this unwarranted conclusion?" asked Khan. "Unlike the US which has been involved in wars [globally]...when has Pakistan shown aggression, especially post-nuclearisation?" he added.

279.title: AAP, others file complaints against BJP candidate for Adampur bypoll
279.article_body: Adampur bypoll candidates from AAP, INLD and three others filed separate complaints with Haryana's Chief Electoral Officer against BJP's nominee Bhavya Bishnoi. The complainants alleged that Bishnoi hid the details of three out of four cases being investigated by the ED against him. The Returning Officer has reportedly said Bishnoi did not hide any fact in his submissions.

280.title: BJP became world's largest party due of leaders like Madan Lal Khurana: Nadda
280.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Saturday said the party has become the world's largest political party because of leaders like Madan Lal Khurana who never wavered from their ideology and commitment towards people. Nadda asked party leaders and workers to learn from Khurana's life. Khurana was involved in numerous political struggles and provided solutions to different issues, Nadda added.

281.title: Telangana's Nalgonda Congress leader Palle Ravi Kumar joins TRS
281.article_body: Nalgonda Congress leader Palle Ravi Kumar and his wife, Chandur MPP Jyothi, joined TRS on Saturday in the presence of the party's working president KT Rama Rao in Hyderabad. Ravi Kumar was among those trying for a chance as Congress candidate for the Munugode by-election. His brother, Palle Vinod, has filed his nomination as a candidate for Telangana Jana Samithi.

282.title: After 'Delhi Crime 2', my son said I've become like Iron Man: Shefali Shah
282.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah revealed that after 'Delhi Crime 2', her son told her that she has become like Iron Man. "He shared...every Marvel superhero has been played by various actors except Iron Man...you've become like that. You cannot be replaced," she said. "I was so touched that I wanted to print and put it on the walls," Shefali added.

283.title: 2 Arunachal youths go missing from near China border; search op underway
283.article_body: Two youths in Arunachal Pradesh have been reported missing for almost two months after they had ventured near the state's border with China in search of medicinal plants. "Their family members lodged missing complaints before the police on October 9," Anjaw SP Rike Kamsi said. "We have contacted the Army and our search and rescue operations are underway," Kamsi added.

284.title: We don't really have a choice in what people call us: NZ skipper Williamson
284.article_body: Showing no concern about the lack of favourites tag for New Zealand at upcoming T20 World Cup, captain Kane Williamson said his side doesn't really have a choice in what people call them. He added that the team will try and focus on the cricket that they want to play. New Zealand finished as runners-up at T20 World Cup 2021.

285.title: One can become Sub-Inspector in K'taka by paying ₹80 lakh: Rahul
285.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that if people have money, they can buy a government job in Karnataka. "If you want to be Police Sub-Inspector, you can be one by paying ₹80 lakh," he added. Calling the state government a "40% commission" government, he questioned why 2.5 lakh government posts were lying vacant in the BJP-ruled state.

286.title: Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is meaningless: K'taka CM Bommai
286.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said the Congress is relaunching its "failed missile" Rahul Gandhi through 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', but the entire exercise is meaningless. "Already, the country has been marching ahead as a united India," the Karnataka CM said. "India is united, and it is making rapid progress on the international level," Bommai added.

287.title: All 4 will die: Man in live Facebook video before BMW hit truck at 230 kmph in UP
287.article_body: Four persons were killed on the Purvanchal Expressway in Sultanpur, Uttar Pradesh. A BMW car that was going at a high speed of 230 kmph had rammed into a container truck. The occupants of the BMW were doing a Facebook Live, with the camera focused on the speedometer. A man can be heard saying, "All four will die."

288.title: Will never forget smell of cigars & beard glue: Rupert on Robbie's demise
288.article_body: Actor Rupert Grint, who played Ron Weasley in the 'Harry Potter' films, took to Instagram to share a post mourning the demise of Robbie Coltrane, who portrayed Hagrid. "I'll never forget the smell of cigars and beard glue - a wonderful combination," he wrote. "[He was]...a giant-hearted man who was still looking out for us even decades later," Rupert added.

289.title: Judicial delay is a major challenge facing the people: PM Modi
289.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said delay in getting justice is one of the main challenges being faced by the people. He made the comment in a video message aired at the 'All India Conference of Law Ministers and Law Secretaries' in Kevadia, Gujarat on Saturday. Modi said new laws should be written lucidly so that they are easy to understand.

290.title: Delhi govt launches 6 scholarship programmes for 2022-23
290.article_body: The Delhi Department for Welfare of SC/ST/OBC/Minorities said six scholarship programmes for students of classes XII and below have been launched for the 2022-2023 academic year. Under the programme, the government will reimburse tuition fees of selected students. The department has issued guidelines to all heads of schools regarding the programmes.

291.title: Petrol tanker overturns after crash in UP, hundreds loot petrol; video goes viral
291.article_body: A video has gone viral showing hundreds of local people looting petrol after a petrol tanker overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh district. The tanker overturned after crashing into a truck following which petrol fell into a ditch. In the video, locals can be seen filling buckets and utensils with petrol.

292.title: Divine spirit attached to film made it a hit: Rishab on Kantara's success
292.article_body: Rishab Shetty, who wrote and directed the Kannada film 'Kantara' in addition to acting in it, spoke about the film's success and said that the "divine spirit and energy attached to the film has made it a blockbuster today". "Also, the people of Karnataka who've promoted the film...and the pride they feel is the reason behind...success of Kantara," he added.

293.title: Mahagathbandhan flag will fly at Centre: Bihar minister Tej Pratap
293.article_body: Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav said that the Opposition will replace BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "Public has rejected the BJP government in Bihar...Last time, I had predicted about Chachaji (Bihar CM Nitish Kumar), today he is with us," Yadav said. He added, "Today, I predict that the flag of Mahagathbandhan will fly at the Centre."

294.title: Vistara to start Pune-Singapore direct flights from December
294.article_body: Vistara airlines will start direct flights between Pune and Singapore from December 2. "As an introductory offer, the all-inclusive Pune-Singapore-Pune round trip will cost ₹17,799 for economy," said Chief Executive Officer of Vistara, Vinod Kannan. The flight will leave Pune on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays at 02:10 hours and reach Singapore at 10:30 hours.

295.title: Incorrect measure of hunger: Govt as India falls 6 places on Global Hunger Index
295.article_body: The government issued a statement as the World Hunger Index ranked India at 107th position among 121 countries, six places below last year. "The index is an erroneous measure of hunger and suffers from serious methodological issues," said the government. The Global Hunger Report is 'misinformed' and "disconnected from ground reality", it added, while raising questions over the indicators used.

296.title: Om Prakash Bakoria appointed Chairman & Managing Director of PMPML
296.article_body: Om Prakash Bakoria has been appointed as the Chairman and Managing Director of Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML). Bakoria earlier served as the Additional Municipal Commissioner of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). In the PMC, Bakoria was involved in several key decisions related to the public transport services, officials said.

297.title: Railways takes up demolition drive in Delhi’s Shakur Basti
297.article_body: Indian Railways demolished around 70 to 80 homes in Northwest Delhi's Shakur Basti on Friday to develop upcoming projects. While locals claimed they were not intimated beforehand of the demolition, a Railways spokesman denied the charge. Pradhan of the settlement, Virendra Kohli, said the houses demolished were home to around 300 to 350 people.

298.title: 67-yr-old businessman abducted in UP's Bulandshahr, case registered
298.article_body: A 67-year-old businessman, identified as Rajkumar, was allegedly abducted when he was out on a morning walk in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr, his family members said on Saturday. Rajkumar runs a hardware business in the district's Khurja city. A case has been registered based on the family's complaint and CCTV footage is being examined, SSP Shlok Kumar said.

299.title: ₹2 cr was illegally levied on coal transportation daily in Chhattisgarh: ED
299.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has claimed that some officials and politicians in Chhattisgarh used to illegally levy charges on coal transportation, generating about ₹2 crore to ₹3 crore daily. Chhattisgarh IAS officer Sameer Vishnoi and two others were arrested in the case on Thursday. One of the arrested has admitted that he handled the illegally levied sums of money.

300.title: Putin warns of "global catastrophe" if NATO clashes with Russian army
300.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned that any direct clash of NATO troops with Russia could lead to a "global catastrophe". "I hope...those...who are saying this are smart enough not to take such a step," he stated. Putin also claimed he had no regrets about invading Ukraine and that Russia's partial mobilisation of troops should be completed within two weeks.

301.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police book 283 cases for drunk driving
301.article_body: A mega drunk and drive checking was conducted by Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday night during which 283 cases were registered. Cases were booked against 210 two-wheeler riders, 63 four-wheeler drivers, seven three-wheelers and three heavy vehicles. "Strict action will be taken against those who drive under the influence of alcohol," Cyberabad Police tweeted.

302.title: 2 policemen attacked by village mob in Punjab's Kapurthala
302.article_body: Two police personnel were allegedly attacked by a mob in a village in Punjab's Kapurthala district on Saturday. A feud took place between constable Parminder Singh and a man after the car driven by the former overtook the villager's vehicle, police said. Later, a mob of around 20 people attacked Parminder and another constable Navdeep Singh with swords and sticks.

303.title: ED summons Anubrata's daughter to inquire about her 'huge' wealth
303.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned the daughter of arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal to its headquarters in Delhi on October 27 in connection with the cattle smuggling case. Sukanya Mondal will be interrogated about the source of the "huge" wealth she has amassed in the past few years, an official said. Sukanya is a school teacher in West Bengal.

304.title: Death toll from coal mine explosion in Turkey reaches 41
304.article_body: The death toll from a coal mine explosion in Turkey's Bartin province on Friday has risen to 41, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said on Saturday. Earlier, Turkey's Interior Minister said 58 of the 110 people working in the mine were either rescued or got out by themselves. The explosion is believed to have been caused by a methane build-up.

305.title: 140 exotic animals & birds smuggled from Myanmar rescued in Mizoram
305.article_body: Mizoram Police, in a joint operation with the Excise and Narcotics Department, rescued 140 exotic animals and birds in Champhai. The animals, including 30 tortoises, 55 crocodile hatchlings and 22 pythons, are suspected to have been smuggled from Myanmar. As per reports, police arrested three persons in this connection and intercepted three vehicles.

306.title: Father figure for me was somebody on phone: Ali Fazal on parents' divorce
306.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal said that his parents got divorced when he was in Class 12, and the father figure for him was somebody on the phone. "It had become a system that once or twice in a year, we had to go and meet him," he said. "I've nothing against him. But it had become transactionary," he added.

307.title: My strengths helped me a lot: Deepti on winning Player of the Tournament award
307.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Tournament' in Women's Asia Cup, India all-rounder Deepti Sharma said she just backs her strengths and that helped her a lot in Sylhet. "The wickets were slow and before this tournament, I worked a lot on my batting and those sessions really helped me," she added. Deepti scored 94 runs and took 13 wickets.

308.title: China reserves right to use force over Taiwan: CCP spokesperson
308.article_body: China reserves the right to use force over Taiwan as the last resort in compelling circumstances, however, a peaceful reunification is Beijing's first choice, a Chinese Communist Party (CCP) spokesperson said on Saturday. The reunification of China and Taiwan is in the interest of everyone, including Taiwan compatriots, CCP spokesperson Sun Yeli told a news conference in Beijing.

309.title: Hope Dybala, Di Maria recover from their injuries before WC: Messi
309.article_body: Argentinian skipper Lionel Messi said that he hopes that two of the team members namely Angel Di Maria and Paulo Dybala recover from their injuries before the start of the FIFA World Cup. "It's (injuries) a concern because it's a different WC...[and] we're so close that any little thing that can happen to you can leave you out," Messi said.

310.title: Large amounts of nutrients not good for Bengaluru's Uttarahalli Lake: Expert
310.article_body: According to an expert, the presence of a large quantity of nutrients in Bengaluru's Uttarahalli Lake is not good and the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike should take up bio-remediation measures. "Eutrophication happens when large amounts of nutrients enter...due to sewage...[and lake's] catfishes were also noticed gasping for air," the expert said. Notably, Uttarahalli Lake spans 15.16 acres.

311.title: 2 people who went fishing die due to lightning in Thane
311.article_body: Two people from Chiradpada village in Thane's Bhiwandi reportedly died due to lightning and heavy rains on Friday evening. They were returning home from fishing at the Bhatsa river when the lightning struck them, a Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) official said. While two persons died on the spot, two others were injured in the incident, the official added.

312.title: Talented teammates will give Neymar great support at WC: Ronaldo
312.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming FIFA World Cup, Ex-Brazil footballer Ronaldo said that the current set of players will give Neymar the best supporting cast he has ever had with the Brazilian national team. "This is definitely a better team than the ones Brazil had in the last three WCs. But the responsibility always lies with the biggest star," Ronaldo said.

313.title: Man arrested for attacking priest, pelting stones at Thane ashram
313.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been arrested in Thane for allegedly attacking a priest with a knife at an ashram in the city. The accused, who was in an inebriated state, pelted stones at the ashram and attacked the 63-year-old priest when questioned by him. A man present at the ashram intervened and snatched the knife from the accused.

314.title: Woman leaves note calling Putin 'serial killer' on his parents' grave in Russia
314.article_body: A 60-year-old woman has been detained in Russia for allegedly leaving a note calling Russian President Vladimir Putin a "serial killer" and wishing for his death. Irina Tsybaneva faces five years in jail for leaving the note which reportedly said, "Parents of a serial killer, take him with you." The note added, "You raised a freak and a killer."

315.title: Who are the past winners of T20 World Cup?
315.article_body: Australia are the defending T20 World Cup champions. India won inaugural edition in 2007. Pakistan, who were runners-up in 2007, won their maiden title in 2009, beating Sri Lanka in the final. England won the 2010 edition, while Sri Lanka won the 2014 edition. West Indies have won T20 World Cup the most number of times (twice: 2012 and 2016).

316.title: Kerala Guv Arif Mohammed Khan's FB account hacked; police informed
316.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan's Facebook account was hacked on Saturday, police said. "The matter has been reported and efforts are on to restore the page," Khan said, according to the Kerala Rajbhavan PRO. As per reports, there are three posts on the account that show hardware or construction-related videos, along with descriptions of the same in Arabic script.

317.title: It's an Indian spy-thriller without bikinis & six packs: Karthi on 'Sardar'
317.article_body: Actor Karthi, while speaking about his upcoming film 'Sardar', said, "People keep asking me if 'Sardar' is touted to be a James Bond film, will it have bikini scenes and six packs?" He added that it is an Indian spy-thriller without bikinis and six packs. "So, it is for all family audiences," Karthi further said.

318.title: We should give credit to bowlers: Harmanpreet on India's Asia Cup win
318.article_body: Following India's eight-wicket win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup final, India skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said, "We should give credit to the bowlers and the fielding unit was very good today from ball one." Renuka Singh's 3/5 in three overs and Sneh Rana and Rajeshwari Gayakwad's two wickets each helped India restrict Sri Lanka to 65/9.

319.title: 2 people die after motorcycles collide in UP's Bijnor
319.article_body: Two persons were killed and as many injured in a collision between two motorcycles in the Rehar area in Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh on Saturday. The deceased, Alauddin (20) and Shekhar (19), were riding their respective motorcycles and died on the spot, police said. The incident happened at around 2 pm in front of Inter College Bhaguwala, police added.

320.title: T20 retirement not on my mind, it's a format I love playing: Finch
320.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that he hasn't thought about retiring from the T20 format. "To retire from ODI cricket was quite nice. I think it took a little bit of weight off my shoulders," Finch said. The 35-year-old batter added, "But haven't even had it cross my mind about the T20 format. It's a format that I love playing."

321.title: IED weighing around 18 kg detected & destroyed in J&K's Bandipora
321.article_body: Security forces detected and destroyed an improvised explosive device (IED) in J&K's Bandipora district on Saturday. The IED, weighing around 18 kg and fitted with two gas cylinders, was found in close proximity to the Bandipora-Sopore road, according to officials. A joint search operation had been launched in the area based on intelligence received from the police, the army informed.

322.title: Was told 'Why're you dancing? Look after the house': Madhuri on becoming mother
322.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit in an interview spoke about how society's perception of her changed after she got married and became a mother. She said, "These things happen...there are many who say 'Now you're a mom, why are you dancing? You please sit, look after the house'." However, Madhuri added that none of these things ever bothered her.

323.title: Unidentified persons booked for duping Gurugram man of ₹4 lakh
323.article_body: Police have booked unidentified persons for allegedly defrauding a resident of Gurugram's Sushant Lok Phase-I. According to police, Satvinder Singh Tanwar deposited ₹4 lakh into three different bank accounts after he received what he believed to be a request for monetary help from his US-based friend over WhatsApp. Tanwar later learned that his friend's WhatsApp account had been hacked.

324.title: Champions of Asia: Jaffer on India's record 7th title in Women's Asia Cup
324.article_body: Reacting to India winning a record-extending seventh title in Women's Asia Cup, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "Champions of Asia. Congratulations." He added, "To win seven out of the last eight Asia Cups is absolute domination." Virat Kohli tweeted, "Way to go." Chasing 66, India scored 71/2 in 8.3 overs to defeat Sri Lanka in the final.

325.title: 2 arrested in Mumbai for robbing ₹10 lakh by posing as CBI officers
325.article_body: The Mumbai Crime Branch arrested a hospital ward boy and a tiffin supplier for allegedly posing as CBI officials and robbing a 70-year-old man of ₹10 lakh. Police have recovered ₹3.25 lakh from the duo and are on the lookout for their three accomplices. The accused accosted the victim at a bus stop and took his bag containing the amount.

326.title: Mallikarjun Kharge joins Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka's Ballari
326.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Mallikarjun Kharge joined Rahul Gandhi and other leaders in the Bharat Jodo Yatra while it was crossing Karnataka's Ballari district. Kharge also took part in the mega public meeting in the district to celebrate the yatra reaching the 1,000-km milestone. The yatra will exit Karnataka on October 20 after covering 511 km in 21 days.

327.title: 3.4 kg gold worth ₹1.7 cr seized at Kerala's Kozhikode airport
327.article_body: A total of 3.4 kg of gold, worth ₹1.7 crore, was seized and two passengers who arrived at Kerala's Kozhikode airport were arrested, according to DRI officials. The gold was concealed in the body of the passengers who arrived from Doha, officials added. "The officers, acting on the information, mounted surveillance...and [arrested] both the carriers," a DRI statement said.

328.title: I'm happy being single: Rajev on reports saying he got married for 2nd time
328.article_body: Actor Rajev Paul, ex-husband of actress Delnaaz Irani, has dismissed reports that claimed he has tied the knot again. Reports surfaced after the actor shared a picture on Instagram where he could be seen dressed as a groom. Stating that it was a wedding sequence from his show, Rajev said, "I'm happy being single and don't want to get married."

329.title: Crops damaged due to unseasonal rains: Agriculture Minister
329.article_body: Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar on Saturday said that unseasonal rains have damaged crops. "The survey is underway and we are waiting for reports from the states to assess the extent of damage," Tomar said. Farmers are dependent on monsoon, which is unpredictable, he said, adding that despite all measures in place, cultivators are at the mercy of nature.

330.title: Eateries in Bengaluru can stay open till 1 am: Police Commissioner
330.article_body: After receiving multiple complaints about policemen forcing eateries in Bengaluru to shut by 11 pm, city Police Commissioner Pratap Reddy has issued an order allowing them to remain open until 1 am throughout the week. He has directed the police personnel to follow the government order issued in 2016 that allows eateries to operate between 6 am and 1 am.

331.title: Shami's estranged wife Hasin accuses TTE of misbehaving with her during train journey
331.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami's estranged wife Hasin Jahan has accused a TTE of misbehaving with her while she was travelling on a train from Kolkata to Bihar. She stated that the TTE used abusive language and also threw her mobile away. "Later I took help from the police and returned to the city under security escorts," she added.

332.title: Twitter user calls Big B 'weakest link' of 'Chupke Chupke', Dharmendra reacts
332.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra responded to a fan who tweeted that Amitabh Bachchan was "the weakest link" of 1975 movie 'Chupke Chupke'. The fan had reacted to a critic who, in an opinion piece, said Amitabh was "so nuanced and natural" in the film. "Stop running down Dharmendra for someone else's PR," the fan added. Dharmendra responded, "So sweet. Love you."

333.title: SC rejects Meta's plea against CCI probe into WhatsApp's privacy policy
333.article_body: The Supreme Court has dismissed Meta's pleas challenging the investigation ordered by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) into WhatsApp's updated privacy policy of 2021. "The CCI is an independent authority to consider any violation of the provisions of the Competition Act of 2002...[and] cannot be dissuaded from investigation," a bench of Justices MR Shah and Sudhanshu Dhulia said.

334.title: It's not all doom and gloom for us: SA captain Bavuma ahead of T20 WC
334.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said his side is looking forward to T20 World Cup 2022 and how far they can go in Australia. "It's not all doom and gloom for us. We're excited...Probably not a lot of expectations around us as a team again," he added. South Africa have never reached the T20 World Cup final so far.

335.title: New ad features Ranbir Kapoor, Ananya Panday as a couple; fans call out their age gap
335.article_body: An advertisement featuring 40-year-old Ranbir Kapoor and 23-year-old Ananya Panday as a couple has been called out by fans over their age difference. "Entire ad I was waiting for a twist to show their relationship anything other than romantic," wrote a person. "I can't get over the glaring age difference," another comment read. However, some fans appreciated the pair's chemistry.

336.title: Stray dog mauls 3-year-old girl to death, injures others in Odisha
336.article_body: A three-year-old girl playing outside her house was mauled by a stray dog in Odisha's Balangir on Thursday. Deepa Munda died while undergoing treatment at a hospital. Reports claimed the dog bit her head and face, following which it attacked more than five people. Locals claimed it injured at least 12 people. Police said the animal hasn't been traced yet.

337.title: Congress' job is to create quarrels among people: Amit Shah
337.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing the people of Himachal Pradesh, criticised the Congress and said that the party's job is to create quarrels among people. "Himachal Pradesh is going to set a new custom that is 'ek baar BJP, baar baar BJP'…Congress cannot sit in peace without creating enmity among the people," said Shah.

338.title: Elephant found dead in forest in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh
338.article_body: An elephant was found dead in a forest near Khentabahari village in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh district. The carcass was found under Chhal range on Friday evening and a post-mortem was underway to find the cause of death, an official said. Notably, Chhattisgarh has reported 45 elephant deaths in the last four years. The causes range from ailments and age to electrocution.

339.title: Man impersonates Indian Air Force Wing Commander at Delhi Airport; arrested
339.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly impersonating an Indian Air Force Wing Commander at Delhi Airport on Saturday. The accused, Feroz Gandhi, is a resident of East Delhi. An entry passport issued in 2016, through which he had been getting easy entry at the airport, was recovered from him. Several incriminating documents regarding Air Force were recovered from his home.

340.title: Nitish Kumar's boat collides with pillar in Ganga river in Bihar, CM safe
340.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's boat collided with a pillar of JP Setu in Ganga river in the state on Saturday. The incident took place when the CM was inspecting ghats in Patna for the upcoming Chhath festival. Kumar and other people who were onboard the boat were safe after the accident, ANI reported. The boat sustained no significant damage.

341.title: Iran denies providing weapons to Russia to be used in Ukraine
341.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian said Iran hasn't supplied Russia with weapons to be used in the Ukraine war. "We've defence cooperation with Russia, but our policy on...Ukraine war is against sending weapons to the conflicting sides and support an end to the war," he added. Ukraine has claimed that Iranian drones were used in Russian attacks in several cities.

342.title: Expired drug kills 10 child leukaemia patients in Yemen
342.article_body: At least 10 children being treated for leukaemia have died after being administered expired doses of cancer treatment in Yemen's Houthi rebel-held capital Sanaa, medical officials and workers said. The medication was reportedly smuggled into the country. Yemen's conflict, now entering its eighth year, has caused one of the world's worst humanitarian crises and has killed over 1,50,000 people.

343.title: K'taka govt fined ₹2,900 cr by NGT for failure to manage solid, liquid waste
343.article_body: The National Green Tribunal has imposed a penalty of ₹2,900 crore on the Karnataka government for failure to manage solid as well as liquid waste. "The total compensation comes to ₹3,396 crore…We have deducted the amount of ₹500 crore levied as compensation vide order dated October 10," said the Tribunal in a statement.

344.title: Sweden rejects joint investigation into Nord Stream leaks
344.article_body: Sweden has rejected plans for formal joint investigation with Denmark and Germany to look into gas leaks at the Nord Stream 1 and 2 pipelines citing national security concerns, according to a Swedish prosecutor. Mats Ljungqvist said a joint investigation would include legal agreements under which Sweden would have to share information from its own investigation that it deemed confidential.

345.title: BMC takes up responsibility of cleaning hospitals, to spend ₹74 cr
345.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has taken up the responsibility of cleaning hospitals for which it will outsource the cleaning work at seven civic-run hospitals to private agencies. The estimated cost of the project is ₹74 crore. "The paan stains on walls and trash dumped in the open have been a major challenge to cleanliness," a civic official said.

346.title: Indian economy projected to grow at 7% in FY23 despite global headwinds: FM
346.article_body: Indian economy is projected to grow at 7% in the current fiscal despite global headwinds, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. This is an outcome of the conducive domestic policy environment and the government's focus on key structural reforms, she said. "India is leading the world in terms of digital payments innovations with our transaction cost being the lowest," she stated.

347.title: 23 noise pollution hotspots identified across Delhi
347.article_body: The Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) has identified 23 locations across the city as noise pollution hotspots, according to a report submitted to the National Green Tribunal (NGT). The 'hotspots' were identified on the basis of real-time noise monitoring data assessed at 31 locations. Jahangirpuri, Karol Bagh, Kashmere Gate, and Anand Vihar are among the locations on DPCC's hotspot list.

348.title: Finch surprises Babar with birthday cake at T20 WC captains' presser, ICC shares video
