348.article_body: The ICC has shared a video showing Australia captain Aaron Finch surprising Pakistan captain Babar Azam with a birthday cake during the T20 World Cup 2022 captains' press conference. In the video, Babar, who turned 28 today, can be seen cutting the cake as captains of the other 15 teams, including Rohit Sharma watched on.

349.title: Defending champions Australia are favourites for T20 WC 2022: Buttler
349.article_body: Talking about upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia, England captain Jos Buttler stated that the defending champions Australia are the favourites for the tournament. He said that the host nation are "slight favourites" in big tournaments as they know conditions better than any other team. Australia will play against New Zealand in their first match on October 22.

350.title: Varun criticises UP govt for not postponing UPSSSC PET amid floods
350.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi has criticised Uttar Pradesh government, saying that despite demands, UPSSSC Preliminary Eligibility Test (PET) wasn't postponed nor were adequate transport arrangements made for students to reach exam centres amid floods in the state. He also shared photos of crowds in trains and at railway stations. "'Ground realities' are perhaps not visible from 'aerial surveys'," he added.

351.title: GHMC officials to inspect eateries in Hyderabad to curb adulteration
351.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will form teams of Food Safety Officers, Assistant Medical Officers of Health (AMOH) and veterinary officials and conduct inspections at eateries to curb adulteration of food. GHMC Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal warned that officials will be held responsible if adulterated food is sold. She asked officials to submit reports on inspections conducted.

352.title: IFS officer shares screenshot of fake job offer for '₹9,700 salary', warns people
352.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted a screenshot of a fake job offer he received via SMS. "Finally got the job offer. Now confused what to do," he joked while sharing the screenshot that read, "Salary is ₹9,700." "These days many fraudulent...agencies keep sending these kinds of SMS...Don't...click on the links. It can lead to data theft...or financial fraud," Kaswan added.

353.title: Kohli keeps on practising despite being told his time is up, video of reaction goes viral
353.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli kept on practising in the nets despite being told by a support staff member that his time is up. A video has gone viral showing Kohli's reaction on being asked to stop the practice. In the video, Kohli can be heard saying, "When Deepak Hooda will come, I will leave."

354.title: UK-based woman cheats people of ₹9.60 crore; arrested in Mumbai
354.article_body: A UK-based woman was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly cheating multiple people to the tune of around ₹9.60 crore. The accused, Nisha Dusara (34), was named in various cases of fraud across different police stations. However, the one filed in Malad in July this year helped police catch her, in which she had cheated two people of ₹72 lakh.

355.title: Germany made a mistake by siding with NATO in Ukraine war: Putin
355.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that Germany made a mistake by siding with NATO in the Ukraine war. Putin said that the decision to cancel the Nord Stream 2 pipeline was a German one. "German citizens, businesses and its economy are paying for this mistake, because it has negative economic consequences for the Eurozone as a whole," he added.

356.title: PM Modi pays tribute to APJ Abdul Kalam on his 91st birth anniversary
356.article_body: PM Narendra Modi paid tribute to the country’s former President APJ Abdul Kalam on his 91st birth anniversary and recalled his contributions. "He is greatly admired for his contribution to our nation as a scientist and as a President who struck a chord with every section of society," tweeted PM Modi. He was born in Tamil Nadu's Rameswaram in 1931.

357.title: Reserved category certificate not mandatory for seeking govt jobs: Raj CM
357.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot approved a proposal allowing candidates from reserved categories to apply for government jobs even if they don't possess a certificate. Those belonging to other backward class (OBC), most backward class (MBC) or economically weaker section (EWS) can apply by submitting an affidavit if they don't have a certificate due to any reason, an order stated.

358.title: 20,874 cattle infected with lumpy skin disease in MP, 336 dead
358.article_body: As many as 20,874 cattle have got infected with lumpy skin disease across 31 districts of Madhya Pradesh till October 13, an official said on Saturday. Out of the total infected, 336 animals died, while 18,351 have recovered, added the official. Dhar, Betul, Morena, Ratlam, Ujjain and Khandwa are among the worst-hit districts, said officials.

359.title: Russian reservists likely buying their own body armour: UK
359.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said that many Russian reservists called up to fight in Ukraine are probably having to buy their own body armour. The "modern 6B45 vest" was selling online in Russia for $638, over triple its price since April, it added. "Endemic corruption and poor logistics remain one of the...causes of Russia's poor performance in Ukraine," it further said.

360.title: World no. 1 Swiatek reaches her 11th semi-final of 2022 at San Diego Open
360.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek reached her 11th semi-final of the season after defeating American Coco Gauff 6-0, 6-3 in San Diego Open quarter-final. The victory is Swiatek's 62nd of the season and 40th on hard court. The 21-year-old will face fourth-seeded Jessie Pegula in Saturday's semi-final. Swiatek has won seven titles, including two Grand Slams, in 2022 so far.

361.title: Bengaluru-bound Akasa Air flight suffers bird hit, returns safely to Mumbai
361.article_body: Bengaluru-bound Akasa Air Boeing 737MAX that took off from Mumbai returned to its origin after a burning smell was reported in the cabin. It underwent an inspection after landing, during which it was found that the burning smell was caused due to bird hit, a DGCA official said. Bird remains were also found on engine number one, the official added.

362.title: D-Mart operator Avenue Supermarts' Q2 net profit rises 64% to ₹685 cr
362.article_body: Avenue Supermarts Limited, which owns and operates the retail chain D-Mart reported a 64% surge in consolidated profit to ₹685 crore for the quarter ended September as against ₹418 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue increased by 36% to ₹10,638 crore as against ₹7,789 crore in September 2021 quarter. Avenue Supermarts' total expenses stood at ₹9,925.95 crore, up 36.93%.

363.title: BJP jokers will now call Global Hunger Index report anti-Indian: KTR
363.article_body: TRS leader KT Rama Rao criticised the BJP-led central government over the latest Global Hunger Index report, which showed a deterioration in India's performance. "Yet another amazing achievement of 'NPA Govt'. India slipped from 101st to 107th rank in Global Hunger Index. Instead of accepting failure, [I] am sure BJP jokers will dismiss the report as anti-Indian now," he tweeted.

364.title: 4 booked for cheating doctor in Thane, taking over hospital illegally
364.article_body: Four persons have been booked for allegedly cheating a 79-year-old doctor and taking over his hospital using fabricated documents in Thane, police said on Saturday. The complainant, who retired as a medical officer in 2002, established a hospital in Kalwa and decided to rent it out, police added. The accused fabricated documents and started operating the facility illegally, they said.

365.title: Salman Khan, Katrina Kaif's 'Tiger 3' delayed, to release on Diwali 2023
365.article_body: Salman Khan took to Twitter on Saturday to announce the new release date of 'Tiger 3'. The film, which was previously set to release on April 21, 2023, will now arrive in theatres during Diwali next year. Directed by Maneesh Sharma, it will also feature Katrina Kaif. 'Tiger 3' will be released in Hindi, Tamil and Telugu.

366.title: Modi added his caste to OBC list while he was CM of Gujarat: Lalan Singh
366.article_body: JD(U) National President Lalan Singh has claimed that PM Narendra Modi belongs to a "backward" caste and also accused him of duplicity. "PM Modi projected himself from the Extremely Backward Class (EBC) caste. I want to tell you that there is no EBC in Gujarat. When he became Gujarat's CM, he merged his caste into the OBC," said Singh.

367.title: Pune's Shivajinagar records 74.3 mm of rain in less than 2 hrs: IMD
367.article_body: Pune's Shivajinagar recorded 78.1 mm of rainfall between 8.30 am and 8.30 pm, with 74.3 mm between 4 pm and 5.30 pm on Friday, IMD said. Pashan, Magarpatta, Lavale and Chinchwad recorded 48.4 mm, 36.5 mm, 30.5 mm and 8.7 mm of rainfall, respectively, IMD added. Several parts of Pune witnessed water-logging and traffic jams following intense rainfall on Friday.

368.title: People like Rahul Gandhi will always remain unemployed: BJP MLA
368.article_body: BJP MLA CT Ravi on Friday stated that people like Congress MP Rahul Gandhi will always remain unemployed. The National General Secretary of BJP added, "Congress has lost all the states under...[Rahul Gandhi's] leadership." Ravi further said that the 52-year-old leader "must try some other country" as he'll not be able to relaunch himself in India through 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

369.title: Mumbai-based journalist manhandled by policeman in Kurla
369.article_body: A city-based journalist was allegedly manhandled by a traffic police personnel following an argument in Kurla, Mumbai on Friday. The journalist complained to the traffic cop near the railway station about the difficulty in hailing an auto rickshaw which led to an altercation between the two, an official said. Notably, a non-cognisable offence was registered at the Kurla Police Station.

370.title: UK police charge activists who threw soup at Van Gogh's $84 mn painting
370.article_body: Two women climate activists have been charged with criminal damage after throwing tomato soup over Vincent van Gogh's painting 'Sunflowers' at London's National Gallery, UK police said on Saturday. The Friday incident had caused minor damage to the frame but the painting was unharmed, the gallery said. The painting is estimated to be worth over $84 million.

371.title: List of cricketers who checked-in at NCA for injury rehab surfaces, Kohli doesn't feature
371.article_body: A list has surfaced online showing Team India cricketers who checked-in at NCA for injury rehab in the last one year. Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli is one of the senior cricketers who doesn't feature on the list. The list includes Rohit Sharma, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant, Ajinkya Rahane, Cheteshwar Pujara and Mohammad Shami, among others.

372.title: ICC names 'most explosive batters' who will feature in T20 World Cup 2022
372.article_body: ICC, on its official website, named the "most explosive batters" who will feature in T20 World Cup 2022. The list includes India's Suryakumar Yadav, who has a T20I strike rate of 176.81. Suryakumar is followed by New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham and Finn Allen, Australia's Tim David, West Indies' Evin Lewis, and South Africa's Rilee Rossouw and Aiden Markram, among others.

373.title: 15-yr-old Jaipur girl attempts suicide after blackmail by rapists
373.article_body: A 15-year-old girl in Rajasthan's Jaipur tried to end her life in order to escape the blackmail by her rapists. The girl was first raped by a man and later blackmailed into being sexually assaulted by four other persons known to him. The rapist further blackmailed her into paying ₹50,000 to not release video clips of the assault.

374.title: Several parts of Pune to face disruption in water supply tomorrow
374.article_body: Several parts of Pune will face a disruption in water supply tomorrow due to maintenance and repair work on the water pipeline between Parvati and Cantonment. The city's civic body's water department head Aniruddha Pawaskar said that leakage had been found in the water pipeline and it's necessary to repair it. Areas like Yerawada, Hadapsar, Mundhwa, etc will be affected.

375.title: Section 144 to be imposed in Hyd for TSPSC Group 1 exams on Sunday
375.article_body: Section 144 of the CrPC will be imposed in areas around centres conducting Telangana State Public Service Commission (TSPSC) Group 1 exams across Hyderabad and Secunderabad on Sunday. The curfew will be in effect from 6:00 am on Sunday to 6:00 am on Monday. Assembly of four or more people within 500 yards of the centres will be prohibited.

376.title: Military mobilisation should be finished in 2 weeks: Russian President
376.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that 2,22,000 out of 3,00,000 reservists have already been mobilised and all mobilisation activities will be finished in two weeks. Defending his decision to mobilise Russians, Putin said the front line was too long to defend solely with contract soldiers. Putin added that so far, Russia has no plans to launch massive air strikes.

377.title: Team India will prepare more while facing SL than WI: Irfan on T20 WC
377.article_body: Irfan Pathan said Team India will prepare more while facing Sri Lanka in comparison to West Indies during the T20 World Cup 2022. "The quality of the Sri Lankan side is much better compared to West Indies...Recently, they've beaten India in the Asia Cup," added Irfan. Gautam Gambhir termed Sri Lanka as a team that's peaking at the right time.

378.title: I hope Suryakumar becomes X-factor for India: Rohit ahead of T20 WC
378.article_body: Speaking about Suryakumar Yadav ahead of T20 World Cup, India captain Rohit Sharma said the batter is in good form. "I hope he continues to bat in that way, high on confidence. He's a confident player...plays fearlessly...uses his skill set efficiently. I hope he becomes the X-factor," he added. India will play their first match against Pakistan on October 23.

379.title: Woman accused in constable's murder during 2020 riots arrested from Noida
379.article_body: A 27-year-old woman, an accused in Delhi Police head constable Ratan Lal's murder during the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots, has been arrested from Noida after two years. The woman had fled her home after being named a suspect in the case, police said. "We found that she had moved to Noida and got married recently," police added.

380.title: HDFC Bank's Q2 net profit rises 22.3% to ₹11,125 cr, revenue up 18.3%
380.article_body: HDFC Bank reported a 22.3% surge in consolidated net profit at ₹11,125 crore in the quarter ended September as against ₹9,096.19 crore in the year-ago period. This was led by a 23% loan growth. HDFC Bank's net revenue rose by 18.3% to ₹28,869.8 crore for the said quarter from ₹24,409.7 crore in the corresponding period in the previous financial year.

381.title: Heavy rains cause flooding in Pune, residents blame Smart City plan
381.article_body: Several parts of Pune, including Deccan, Fergusson College Road, Jangli Maharaj Road and Apte Road reported flooding after the city received heavy rains on Friday. Blaming the Smart City plan for waterlogging, a resident said, "Footpaths are not built high enough at low-lying areas." "Authorities sealed many drainage lines as part of the Pune Smart City plan," another citizen added.

382.title: What are the rates at which employees are leaving India's top IT companies?
382.article_body: Infosys has reported an attrition rate of 27.1% for the July to September quarter, the highest among top IT companies in India. While attrition at HCL Tech remained at 23.8%, TCS reported a higher rate of 21.5% and Wipro posted a marginal fall to 23% compared to previous quarter. Attrition rate measures how many employees are voluntarily leaving a company.

383.title: Gurugram residents to be fined ₹500 for not segregating household waste
383.article_body: Residents who do not segregate their household waste before handing it over to the sanitation workers will be fined ₹500 from October 20, Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has announced. The ward-level teams will be conducting targeted and random inspections to find the violators. Residents are expected to segregate the biodegradable, dry and rejected sanitary waste into three separate bins.

384.title: Pakistani female DJ says she got rape, death threats after performing at music festival
384.article_body: Pakistani female DJ Neha Khan has recently revealed that she received rape and death threats after performing at Hunza Music festival last year. She had performed with five male artists at the festival. Neha said that she and her team were accused of sabotaging the local culture and the national norms of the Hunza valley, reports stated while quoting her.

385.title: Robbie Coltrane was like the most fun uncle I've ever had: Emma Watson
385.article_body: Mourning the demise of her 'Harry Potter' co-star Robbie Coltrane, Emma Watson wrote on Instagram Stories, "Robbie was like the most fun uncle I've ever had." The actress, who played the role of Hermione in the 'Harry Potter' films, added, "I'll really miss your sweetness, your nicknames, your warmth, laughs and...hugs. You made us a family...There was no better Hagrid."

386.title: Russell's viper snake found at police station in Hyderabad, rescued
386.article_body: A Russell's viper snake was found at Bahadurpura Police Station in Hyderabad on Saturday morning. The venomous reptile was caught by a volunteer of non-profit organisation 'Friends of Snakes Society'. The volunteer said the snake might have come out from the Musi River or the nearby zoo due to rains. The snake will be released in the deep forest.

387.title: India's forex reserves rise for 1st time in over 2 months by $204 mn
387.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves rose for the first time in over two months by $204 million to $532.867 billion for the week ending October 7, the RBI data showed. The rise can be attributed to a surge in gold reserves by $1.35 billion to $38.955 billion. The Special Drawing Rights (SDRs) reserve also rose by $155 million to $17.582 billion.

388.title: Cong will get full majority in Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls: Alka Lamba
388.article_body: Congress leader Alka Lamba has exuded confidence that the party will win the upcoming Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh. "We are very confident that Congress will get a full majority. We appeal to all the citizens of the state to think and vote with contemplation because it is a matter of their as well as the state's future," said Lamba.

389.title: India defeat Sri Lanka to win Women's Asia Cup for a record-extending 7th time
389.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by eight wickets in the final in Sylhet to win Women's Asia Cup for a record-extending seventh time. Bowling first after losing the toss, India restricted Sri Lanka to 65/9. India chased down the target in 8.3 overs. India's seven Women's Asia Cup victories include four in ODI format and three in T20I format.

390.title: Salman Khan's fan says Sona Mohapatra has a 'eunuch's face', singer responds
390.article_body: Sona Mohapatra, who called out a channel for roping in Sajid Khan on 'Bigg Boss 16', has been trolled by a Salman Khan fan who said she has a "eunuch's face". "Getting d***s hard, might be...job of...women supporting...#SajidKhan and riding horses in #Salman Bhai's farmhouse, not mine," she replied. Sona had earlier criticised Salman over Sajid's participation in the show.

391.title: Aus are favourites for WC, floor gap between them, other teams: Shastri
391.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Australia will be favourites for the T20 World Cup 2022, adding that there's "no question" about that. "I will put them...then there will be a floor gap and then you can start talking about...other teams," he stated. "The span has been...just about 12 months since they won the World Cup," said Shastri.

392.title: MSRTC to run 1,500 extra buses during Diwali in Maharashtra
392.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has decided to operate around 1,500 extra buses from October 21 to October 31 across the state to cater to the rush of commuters during Diwali. Those above 75 years of age can travel free on any state transport bus and those between 65 and 75 will get a 50% concession.

393.title: Revised guidelines issued for development programme in Hyderabad
393.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has issued revised guidelines after the Telangana government increased the Constituency Development Fund (CDF) from ₹3 crore to ₹5 crore. This amount is provided to MLAs and MLCs for the development of their respective constituencies. As per the revised guidelines, the payment for development work will be done by the District Collector.

394.title: K'taka HC allows cab aggregators to operate autos until govt fixes fares
394.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has allowed app-based cab aggregators including Ola, Uber and Rapido to operate autos until the state government fixes fares. The companies can temporarily charge 10% of base fare as a convenience fee along with 5% of GST. The interim decision comes against the state government's directive which asked ride-hailing apps to discontinue auto services in Bengaluru.

395.title: Russia trying to kill Starlink internet service in Ukraine: Musk
395.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said that Starlink is the only internet service left in Ukraine, and Russia is actively trying to kill it too. "Internet fibre, phone lines, cell towers...have been destroyed. Starlink is all that's left. For now," Musk tweeted. Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said Musk is among the world's top private donors supporting Ukraine.

396.title: Shouldn't country be freed from dynastic politics, asks Amit Shah
396.article_body: Addressing a rally in the poll-bound Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said, "Shouldn't the country be freed from dynastic politics? PM [Narendra] Modi has done the work of ending 'parivarvad' in politics." "Congress, in the desire for power, hasn't been able to respect our heritage," he added.

397.title: Brothers sentenced to 40 yrs in prison for murdering Maltese journalist
397.article_body: Two brothers were sentenced to 40 years in prison each on Friday after admitting to the murder of Maltese anti-corruption journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia. She was killed by a car bomb on October 16, 2017. Known as the "one-woman WikiLeaks", Galizia uncovered networks of corruption in Malta and abroad. She was also known as a harsh critic of the government.

398.title: Brightest-ever gamma ray burst spotted, NASA shares pic of its afterglow
398.article_body: Astronomers spotted the brightest-ever gamma ray burst (GRB) that occurred 2.4 billion light years from Earth. It was likely triggered by a supernova explosion giving birth to a black hole and the burst lasted for more than 10 hours. NASA shared a picture of the afterglow captured by Swift's X-Ray Telescope about an hour after the GRB was first detected.

399.title: Woman's sexually provocative dress isn't a license to man to outrage her modesty: HC
399.article_body: Kerala High Court's Justice Kauser Edappagath observed that objectifying a woman based on her attire cannot be justified, adding, "Even if a woman wears a sexually provocative dress, that cannot give a license to a man to outrage her modesty." The court added that there cannot be any thought that women dress only to lure male attention.

400.title: We'll take a lot of risks without worrying about result: Rohit on T20 WC
400.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said he and his team will look to take a "lot of risks" without worrying about the result during the T20 World Cup 2022. "Teams have become fearless...We're...looking to adopt the same approach," added Rohit. "140 used to be a winning total...[in 2007] but these days teams aim to reach there in 14-15 overs," he stated.
